39353854.review:
Overall this is a nice game, a good mix between a Hidden Object and a Point & Click adventure; I enjoyed playing it. 
However [u]easy puzzles[/u] and the duration of [u]about 1 hour for each episode[/u] (4 in total) are the two biggest cons.
The story is ok but leave the player with a cliffhanger, which suggests there will be a sequel.

[h1]Worth to play?[/h1]
Yes, if you are looking for something easy and you like the genre.

[h1]Worth the price?[/h1]
Absolutly not; better wait for sales or get it on bundle.

Also, this is an [b]easy 100%[/b] for achievements hunters.

38739654.review:
Adam Wolfe hebt sich stylistisch von anderen HOPAs (hidden object puzzle adventures) ab. Hier liegt der Fokus verstärkt auf der Interaktion mit anderen Charakteren als auf Rätsel. Das Spiel verspricht ein intensives, narratives Erlebnis, und das bekommt man auch. Man spielt nicht einfach einen unscheinbaren Charakter, der sich durch diverse Rätsel kämpfen muss, nein, man spielt Adam Wolfe, den Ermittler für paranormale Fälle.
Im Gegensatz zu anderen Wimmelbildspielen kann man hier sogar Gebrauch von einem Smartphone und einer Schusswaffe machen - beides allerdings nicht optional. Zudem lassen sich mithilfe einer Uhr Tathergänge rekonstruieren.

Die Story ist ziemlich bizarr und gefällt sicherlich nicht jedem, zieht sich aber zusammenhängend durch alle Episoden. Die Rätsel sind teilweise etwas aufwendiger bzw. großflächiger inszeniert, aber dennoch relativ einfach zu meistern.

Wem diese Art von Spielen gefällt, kann ich Adam Wolfe nur empfehlen.

38545781.review:

C'est beau, c'est bien réalisé et c'est malheureusement trop court (Comme toujours avec les très bons jeux, mais vous en avez quand même pour 5 bonnes heures).
Le seul reproche est au niveau du scénario, cela commence bien, mais dans le dernier épisode (Le 4ème), cela tourne un peu au tout et n'importe quoi. Mais heureusement cela reste secondaire face aux nombreuses qualités du jeu.
Je le conseille donc à tous!

38379688.review:
特價時購入全部章節(1-4)
是我個人覺得目前在STEAM上玩過較為優秀的解謎/隱藏物件遊戲

主角是名為Adam Wolfe的超自然事件偵探
一直在尋找兩年前失蹤的妹妹，直到有一天他在遭入侵的房間中發現了一只被刻意遺留；可以回逤時間的手錶
讓他開始接近妹妹失蹤的真相……

有四個章節，建議一定要從第一章開始玩！
三個不同的超自然事件調查，將真相逐漸連結在一起變成了第四章
第四章的劇情構想其實撰寫的很好，但就在我還在想結局該怎麼解決的時候……對，就倉促結束了，爛尾可說是本作一大缺點吧？

人物為寫實風格，但不會崩太大
配音優秀，主角的聲音很好聽
成就好拿
有中文，並且還沒碰過翻譯錯誤的地方，例如常見的彈簧翻譯成春天(頭痛)

下面稍微介紹一下這類型的遊戲的兩大重點

1.尋找隱藏物件：再也不是要你從一大堆不相干的雜物場景中找尋過關道具囉。XDDD
場景的內容與物品一定是跟人物或週遭事物有關，並且出現的數量適中
這一點我很讚賞，不少同類型遊戲的尋找隱藏物件關卡有夠多，以至於玩到後來都覺得很悶
順帶提一下，我最喜歡第二章在酒吧烹煮魔藥尋找物品的那段，酒吧老闆的吐槽太有趣了XD
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1234028251
跳過一次就會少兩個成就（不使用提示找尋跟全成就）
(但我還是有使用了一次，急著看劇情OTZ，小後悔)

2.解謎小遊戲：除了基本機關解鎖小遊戲，還有各式各樣互動小遊戲，例如：飛車追逐、逃生
或是利用你的觀察力或是回逤時間找尋拼湊線索
當然，因為主角是超自然偵探，所以也會碰到一些打鬥場景：閃躲，並且使用你的槍枝反擊！
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1234030730
不再是莫名其妙突然要你解開某道機關謎題鎖，然後那些機關就只是長得很漂亮
如果一直過不了還可以選擇跳過且不影響成就
缺點是小遊戲大部分不會告訴你該怎麼玩，但其實一眼就可以看出自己該做甚麼XD


最簡單的難度真的很簡單，可以安心看劇情
特價時常常會有很優秀的價格，喜愛同類遊戲型的你絕對推薦入手
物超所值呀～

37678382.review:
Adam Wolfe ist ein Wimmelbildspiel, das mehr auf das Erzählen der Geschichte als auf Rätsel und versteckte Objekte ausgerichtet ist; trotzdem ist beides reichlich vorhanden. Die Geschichte lässt sich wohl am besten in den Bereich Mystery einordnen.

Das Spiel wird als Episodentitel mit 4 Episoden angeboten. Meine Spielzeit war zwischen 11 und 12 Stunden für alle Episoden. Die Geschichte ist interessant und anständig erzählt und entfaltet sich in ihrer Gesamtheit über alle 4 Episoden, wobei jede Episode auch einen jeweils abgeschlossenen Handlungsrahmen beinhaltet. 

Die Sprecher geben den Charakteren durchwegs eine anständige oder sogar gute Stimme. 

Die Grafik ist nichts besonderes, jedoch ist die Ästhetik ansprechend. 

Das Gameplay entspricht dem eines normalen Wimmelbildspiels: finde Gegenstand, verwende Gegenstand, löse Puzzle,  nächster Bildschirm. Es gibt zudem ein paar einzigartigen Mechaniken wie etwa eine Zeitreisefunktion um vergangene Ereignisse beobachten und daraus Hinweise zum Lösen der Rätsel gewinnen zu können .

Alles in allem ist Adam Wolfe ein gut gemachtes, storylastiges Wimmelbildspiel. Im Sale kann man das gut mitnehmen.

36973691.review:
Story is engaging enough to keep me interested in playing through to the end.  Hidden object gameplay is designed to be in-context to the environment, so no need to look for an umbrella camouflaged into a tree or something silly like that.  While storyline logic, and character decisions show a complete lack of common sense, the theme itself isn't as cheesy as I thought it would be.  Voice acting is surprisingly above average, and the artwork is beautifully done (animations are awkward by design though).

If you're ever stuck on any gameplay section, there is a hints system at lower difficulty levels (for your convenience, you can change the difficulty during the game).  Overall, it's a fun story to follow along, so this game is worth checking out with a friend.  See the characters make silly decisions and laugh together.  But the gameplay itself isn't as cheesy as a typical hidden object game.

36468659.review:
[h1] Objetos escondidos episódico - funciona? [/h1]

Adam Wolfe é um jogo episódico - 4 episódios - casual, de objetos escondidos onde você vive a pele do detetive do sobrenatural em busca do paradeiro de sua irmã mais nova Allie. 
E aí? 
Isso de episódios funciona num jogo de "hidden object"? Vamos aos + e - de Adam Wolfe. 

[h1] Pontos positivos: [/h1]

* A história é interessante para um jogo casual de O.E. e prende você.

* O personagem me pareceu mais interessante do que eu esperava num jogo assim.

* A ligação dos irmãos é bem escrita, você realmente sente que eles se amam.

* Os personagens secundários são mais "densos" que o costumeiro nesses tipos de jogos.

* A trilha funciona (nada que se destaque para bem ou mal, mas ela funciona com a história).

* A introdução de novas mecânicas num jogo desse estilo (como o relógio do Adam por exemplo).

[h1] Pontos negativos: [/h1]

* Eu não sei se esse lance de episódios é realmente adequado pra esse tipo de jogo. Uma característica dos O.E. é que justamente os puzzles vão se tornando mais complexos à medida que o fim se aproxima. Já aqui eles sempre iniciam do simples ao "difícil" a cada novo episódio o que tira um pouco um dos propósitos de jogos assim - e por ter que recomeçar a dificuldade dos puzzles do fácil ao difícil (a cada episódio novo) isso faz com que você nunca encontre um desafio maneiro de verdade.

* Os puzzles / enigmas são simplórios demais (acho que ao todo encontrei apenas 2 um pouco mais desafiadores).

* Achei a resolução da história meio destoada do clima geral. É um final dramático para um desfecho meio "óbvio" (todos os jogos de O.E. são assim John... ok)

* O elemento MAIS IMPORTANTE num jogo de O.E. é........................... o objeto escondido. Em Adam Wolfe parece que esqueceram disso e você mal terá o prazer deste elemento casual neste game.

* Alguns puzzles simplesmente não fazem muito sentido em relação a história (isso é um jogador assíduo de O.E. falando).

* Devido a sua extrema simplicidade ele é relativamente curto em relação aos demais jogos de seu gênero.

----------

Terminando esta curta análise (lembrando que não sou especialista em análises, sou apenas um jogador dando sua opinião) eu diria em números que Adam Wolfe é um regular [h1] 6 [/h1]

Ele traz novas mecânicas (bem vindas) aos jogos de Objetos Escondidos, mas falha no que (ao meu ver) é o elemento mais importante em jogos casuais assim: Os objetos escondidos / puzzles.

Ele fica ali na média de jogos "ok" pra quem curte este estilo de game. Dentro de sua proposta ele é um pouco simples e raso demais, apesar dos pontos específicos em que se destaca.
Espere um sorteio ou uma promoção muito boa para pegá-lo.

36375610.review:
Buy it. 

Just buy it.

Buy it if you are in to puzzles – good puzzles, an intriguing and amazing story, beautiful art graphics, Buy it if you love extremely well done voice overs – down to the really inferior characters, and if you like some surprises (quite some…) 

Did I mention the superb and really varied puzzles and the good and evolving story?

Buy it if you are a lover of the crime noire genre, if you can accept the mix of the occult and crime investigation, if you like a story where you never know what’s next, if you like a game that might get you a little bit upset some times, if you are thrilled to see new possibilities in the point and click genre, if you like new kinds of performances – and not to forget: – and most important of all: The main character is a male. 
I really, really loved that. It was refreshing.
Buy it if you like a game, that you don’t want to skip until you have finished.
Buy Adam Wolfe. Just buy it …

OK, well, there is another option though:
If you think it is a normal Hidden Object Game, as it is described on Steam – don’t buy it:  
Adam Wolfe has no blurry sequences, no malfunctioning map, no odd story, no endlessly looking for items that do not matter for the story. It is straight out.

That is why Adam Wolfe makes a difference. 

The developers Mad Head Games have really made an effort in making the supreme.
It is an amazing game, and I wish there would be more games with those qualities.

Adam Wolfe is so much high class. I would love to play a sequel – but for the moment it seems that it is not going to happen due to lack of resources. Sigh…

Nevertheless I am going to look for others games from Mad Head Games – seems like they know how to make really decent games.

My point being: Adam Wolfe is one of the best games I have ever played. 

So as I said: Buy it. You will not regret it. 

I didn’t.

Wow... I mean WOW! I can't remember having a hidden object puzzle adventure game (HOPA)... or any other type of game for that matter... so totally WOW me this much since playing Skymist: The Lost Spirit Stones in 2010! 36225722.review:
[quote][url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/11769719/]Больше качественных и интересных обзоров на кураторской страничке Dreams of Genesis.[/url][/quote]

[h1]Мрачновато будет[/h1]

[b]Я очень люблю жанр «квест и поиск предметов», но за последние полгода я прошёл столько этих игр, что, казалось, меня уже невозможно удивить ничем. Везде одно и то же: мистический сюжет, красивая картинка и куча головоломок. Где-то всё это лучше, где-то хуже и только в этом были различия между играми. Ставил я разные отметки, но ни одна игра не вызывала у меня желания оставить её в библиотеке, дабы пройти потом ещё раз. Но потом я познакомился с Alan Wolfe…  [/b]

То, что всё в этом квесте будет не так, как везде видно уже с первых кадров. Игра сделана на совершенно ином уровне. Во-первых, хотелось бы отметить то, что тут катсцены нормальны анимированы. Нас встречает неплохой вступительный ролик с приятным голосом главного героя, который рассказывает нам предысторию сюжета. И подобного качества ролики будут преследовать нас в течение всего прохождения. И это радует, так как виден качественный подход к своим обязанностям. И это ведь только начала. 

Сюжет крутится вокруг парня по имени Адам Вульф, у которого при загадочных обстоятельствах пропала сестра. Он начал её поиски, в ходе которых обнаружил, что не всё в этом мире так просто и везде витает сверхъестественное. Вот он и занялся этим самым сверхъестественным, став детективном в данной области, помогая людям и параллельно занимаясь поисками своей пропавшей сестры. 

Повествование поделено на четыре эпизода, в каждом из которых Адам расследует разные дела, попутно ища зацепки в деле о пропаже своей сестры. И чем дальше в лес – тем больше становится этих зацепок и в четвёртом эпизоде Адам наконец-то добирается до разгадки тайны и… Ладно, об этом чуть позже. Сейчас же непосредственно об эпизодах. Первый – рассказывает нам о вероломном предательстве в кругу бессмертных, которые живут вечно лишь до тех пор, пока они вместе. Одному это надоело и пошло поехало. А кому? Это нам и надо выяснить. Второй эпизод расскажет нам о лжи во благо, в ходе которого нам нужно будет помочь отцу умирающей девочки. Третий поведает нам о несчастной любви, в котором речь пойдёт о художнике и призраке его жены. Четвёртый же эпизод в упор приблизит нас к разгадке тайны исчезновения сестры Адама и шокирует нас своей концовкой, и заставит ожидать второй сезон, который, я надеюсь, таки будет. 
Конечно, сюжет в некоторых местах проседает и глупит, но в целом – добротная история, которая, опять таки, на голову выше банальных «квестовых» текстов. Прописаны диалоги хорошо, озвучены тоже. Загадки эпизодов на порядок интереснее основной истории, но лишь вплоть до четвёртой серии. В общем, дальнейшее повествование без спойлеров невозможно, поэтому могу лишь сказать, что сюжет вас разочаровать не должен. 

Но сюжет – это только пол дела. Другая половина – загадки и геймплейные моменты. И уж тут разработчики разошлись на славу, добавив такое обилии всевозможного интерактива, что просто закачаешься. Помимо стандартного «поиска на мини-локациях», который тут встречается очень редко, имеется масса других элементов, который вас будут увлекать. Во-первых, тут очень великое множество различных головоломок, которые будут встречаться чуть ли не на каждом шагу: пятнашки, геометрические фишки, различные моменты с запоминанием и всё в этом духе. Подобные вещи ни капли не раздражают, а наоборот – не дают заскучать. Также разработчики добавили не мало приятных плюшек. У главного героя имеется детективное зрение, которым он может искать улики. Также есть возможность отматывать время в определённых точках и сопоставлять предметы в двух разных линиях времени. Ну и что уж там говорить, если в этом квесте даже стрельба из револьвера и битвы с боссами есть. Да, конечно, первое – скрипт, а второе – слабо реализовано, но за попытку спасибо. 

Картинка в игре тоже не подкачала. Много локаций, всё блещет детализацией, предметы для взаимодействия практически не выделяются на общем фоне и искать их действительно интересно и увлекательно. Помимо этого, на каждом шагу прикручены различные мини-игры для того, чтобы еще сильнее заинтересовать игрока. Ну, об анимации я уже говорил. Она очень классная. Да, не уровень ААА-проектов, но для квеста – большой шаг. 
Отлично дополняет всё это музыка, которая расслабляет в спокойных моментах и нагоняет адреналина во время схваток или погонь. 

Я уже говорил ранее, что это первая игра данного жанра, которую я оставил у себя в библиотеке. Была масса квестов, которые получали от меня отметку «Шикарно» из-за того, что они просто нереиграбельны. Прошел раз: вроде всё хорошо, но на второй заход не тянет. Тут же я уверен, что ещё не раз вернусь. Интересный, красивый, загадочный и до жути атмосферный детектив, которому просто жизненно необходимо продолжение в виде второго сезона. Тем более, что концовка к этому располагает. С радостью бы поддержал разработчиков рублём.

36163557.review:
[i]Adam Wolfe[/i] is a mix of point 'n' click (PnC) and hidden object game (HoG) with supernatural themes. There are four chapters with an overarching story that has Adam discover the whereabouts of his long lost sister. In between his search are a number of detective cases taken on by the protagonist in a film noir style. The visuals look as though they've been pulled from a high quality graphic novel and really suit the tone of the story. It is refreshing for a simple PnC/HoG hybrid like [i]Adam Wolfe[/i] to offer more than just a slideshow of environments and puzzles.

Some issues I found that bothered me were small subsections of the game's mechanics that held little continuity and kept changing from act to act, such as changing how how puzzles and items worked, throwing me off slightly as I was forced to relearn these segments. The voice work is generally of decent quality but often times I'd hear certain words becoming mumbled and some character recordings to be severely diminished, such as the hobo from the second act and the voice of the sister in the third act. The implementation of the character's faces, expressions, and mouth movements in [i]Adam Wolfe[/i] are a great example of the uncanny valley, with contorted expressions and heads that are sometimes disproportionate to the rest of the body.

Quite often I would find that the puzzles in aren't self contained so the protagonist, Adam Wolfe, would often makes questionable decisions, that don't fit with the internal logic of the game world, such as stealing a fire extinguisher from a hospital only for the player not to realise what it's purpose is for until Adam summons a fire entity for the extinguisher to be used. These are the most egregious issues I noticed, the rest of the game does very well at implementing quality of life benefits such as a quick travel menu and dialogue offering hints without giving away the solution to a puzzle.

I chose to play on the hardest difficulty due to how the lower difficulties were filled with mechanics that can spoil the puzzles. I would strongly recommend any PnC/HoG veteran to play on the hard difficulty setting otherwise it will be incredibly easy to breeze through the game.

Adam Wolfe – отличный казуальный квест, с большим количеством кат-сцен. Как такового поиска предметов здесь мало, чаще приходиться искать предметы и применять их по назначению. 
Вы играете за детектива по паранормальным явлениям Адама Вулфа. Его сестра Элли пропала два года назад и вам во чтобы то ни стало нужно найти её.  Игра состоит из 4-х эпизодов: в первых трёх вы расследуете три разных паранормальных дела; в четвертом – вы ищете свою сестру. В вашем арсенале часы для путешествия во времени; револьвер, чтобы защищаться от врагов и специальный глаз, чтобы видеть скрытые предметы. 
В игре есть качественные русские субтитры. Пройдя всю игру вы получите 100-% игру. Если вы застряли, то прямо в игру разработчик добавил прохождение.
Имеются коллекционные карточки.
Мне очень понравилась игра!
Оценка 10/10

35897197.review:
I've played my share of hidden object games over the last few years, but few of them make a lasting impression. Adam Wolfe is one of them. First of all, this game has, in my opinion, the best art direction among hidden object games. The semi-animated, 2D illustrations are beautifully rendered, and matches the atmosphere perfectly. All dialogues are fully voiced, and with high quality voiceovers, at that. 

The game is arranged like a season of a TV series, with four different episodes involving elementals, ghosts, and a cult, as well as a longer arc spanning the entire game. Each episode lasts about an hour, and the game has a good pacing. None of the puzzles or hidden object minigames are terribly difficult, though, so Adam Wolfe is not exactly for those who are looking for a challenge.

Overall, this somewhat short adventure is a memorable experience, and is recommended for gamers looking for a casual puzzle game with a great story.

35772844.review:
[b] Adam Wolfe 2/5:[/b] Tvůrci vás hned na začátku upozorní, že se jedná o "intenzivní narativní zážitek". Docela by mě tedy zajímalo, jak si poté představují neintenzivní nenarativní zážitek, protože tohle je… No, sled barevných obrazovek, na kterých řešíte jednoduchoučké minihry (nemlich ty samé, co v každé druhé hidden object adventuře), propojených jakože dějem. Chtělo by to být záměrným brakem o detektivovi řešícím à la Gabriel Knight. Je to však otřesně napsané (a ještě hůře nadabované i „zahrané“), že nebýt to tak nezáživně tuctové, tak by to mělo až guilty plesaure rozměr. Paradoxně je však dobře, že postavy ani děj nefungují, protože pak by zdejší „nevíme jak skončit, tak to usekneme v nejvíce WTF momentu“ závěr mohl někoho snad i rozladit. Takto to však opravdu nehrozí. 

 Co se však tvůrcům musí nechat je, že to solidně odsýpá. Každá ze čtveřice epizod je na hodinu až hodinu a půl, aktivity a minihry jsou značně různorodé čili v rámci epizody neděláte jednu činnost dvakrát a žádná z činností/obrazovek není na více než pět minut, abyste to stihli odehrát před příjezdem autobusu (ano, je to určeno spíše na mobilní zařízení než desktopy). Ve výsledku se u toho dá zabít čas, aniž byste byli vyloženě naštvaní nad jeho ztrátou, ale že byste z toho získali cokoli víc než právě jen to zabití času, tak to se opravdu říci nedá.

Having played most of the games that Artifex Mundi and JetDogs either developed or produced, I rate this as the best HOPA style (Hidden Object/Puzzle Adventure) game I have played to date.

It is not the most complicated or even the longest but it has an intriguing story with a lot of depth.  There is no forced playthrough on difficulty levels to complete all Steam Achievements. That is, you are able to tailor the game to your liking and then play to gain all Steam Achievements regardless of your difficulty settings.

All four episodes are well done although I think the ending could have been better.  Well worth your money and time.  You are literally stealing from Mad Head Games if you were/are fortunate to purchase the entire collection at an 85% discount.

9+/10.

35745392.review:
Adam Wolf est un jeu narratif, mélangeant jeux d'enquêtes, d'objets cachés et de puzzles.
N'étant pas une grande adèpte de ce type de jeu, j'ai laissé mes préjugés derrière moi et je ne suis pas déçu.

En effet son scènario et sa bande son font toute la différente et en font une force, ce jeu a su intégrer avec brio les phases d'objets cachés et de mini jeux dans son histoire, la recherche des differents objets demandés devient une partie de plaisir.
Tout le long de ces 4 épisodes, certaines scènes d'actions ajoutent une touche de réalisme et de tension dans l'histoire.
La mise est scène est très rythmé, je ne me suis ennuyé à aucun moment.
Sans oublier qu'au niveau des graphismes il est très jolie, certains lieux sont plaisant à regarder, mélangant parfois une ambiance sombre parsemé de couleurs vives.

Le seul reproche que je ferais à ce jeu c'est la difficulté peu élévé, en effet même si il est possible de mettre le jeu en difficile, rien n'est insurmontable, bien au contraire.
Cependant je pense qu'il faut faire ce jeu avant tout pour sa mise en scène, son histoire et son coté distrayant, sachant que les énigmes ou puzzles ne vous donnerons pas du fil à retordre.

Je recommande vivement ce jeu qui est très bon dans son genre et qui vous fera passer un agréable moment.
C'est avec impatience que j'attends une potentielle suite.

35701657.review:
Fantasy meets Krimi.

Adam Wolfe ist der Hauptcharakter des gleichnamigen Spiels. Von Beruf Detektiv für Übersinnliches gilt es hier Fälle zu lösen, um so näher an seine vermisste Schwester zu kommen. Dabei stößt man auf viele Rätsel und auf eine ziemlich gut erzählte Story, die Lust auf die nächste der 4 Episoden macht, wobei das Ende jedoch sehr antiklimaktisch, also schwach, ist. Insgesamt ist die letzte Episode mir persönlich leider zu abgespaced gewesen.

Gameplaymäßig kann man sich hier auf ein doch sehr einfaches Spiel gefasst machen oder gar sagen, dass wir es mit einem interaktiven Film zu tun haben. Kaum ein Rätsel ist wirklich anspruchsvoll, jedoch dafür meiner Meinung ganz hübsch designt. Ansonsten ist es eben ein Point and Click im Stile eines Wimmelbildes, wo nur selten unten die Worte stehen, sondern eher eine Geschichte erzählt wird, wobei man immer ein Gegenstand nach dem anderen suchen muss. Das fand ich sehr erfrischend für das Genre.

Grafisch ist die Welt in sich stimmig und sieht gut gezeichnet aus. Die Animationen sind hier und da etwas hakelig, aber generell sieht es einfach gut aus. Wer jetzt auf High End Grafik aus ist, ist hier natürlich falsch, aber ich denke man weiß, was man bekommt, wenn man die Screens anschaut. Auch der Sound ist gut gelungen, die englischen Sprecher sind gut, wenn auch manchmal etwas mehr Emotion nicht geschadet hätte.

Fazit also? Kaufempfehlung, wenn es im Angebot ist. Für den vollen Preis würde ich mir diese 6-7 Stunden nicht nochmals holen, für den Angebotspreis schon. Die deutsche Übersetzung ist generell gelungen, hat nur hier und da ein paar kleine Schwächen. So sollte ich in dem einen Wimmelbild z.B. "Stirb" finden, was sich dann als Würfel entpuppt hat.

35680125.review: I'm not recommending "Adam Wolfe."  First, I've got the Season Pass (which contains all 4 episodes) and it still feels unfinished to me.  Second, the game feels more like an interactive movie (or maybe an interactive comic book) than an actual mystery/puzzle game.  Third, the puzzles range from flailing around with the mouse to some trivial puzzles (most of them are easy mouse-clicking, some of them are odd animations involving more mouse-clicking, and only a few are those easy puzzles).  And, finally, I got 7 hours of game play out of it (Episodes 1-4 = 2.1 hours, 1.7 hours, 1.5 hours, and 1.7 hours, respectively).  The current list price for the whole thing is about $20.  So, by my "dollar an hour" metric, the game is WAY overpriced.  I'm currently seeing it on sale for about $3, but even then, with all my above comlaints, I'd say it's not worth it.

差评差评！！！
游戏时间：6.1h
游戏流程：全流程
成就：非全成就

[spoiler]这是我第一篇差评。为何不喜欢的游戏我还要花个五六小时玩儿呢？因为我得花时间搜集理由。
打折蹭史低10元买了全套，不推荐真心想玩解密类游戏的玩家入手。[/spoiler]

[h1]原因：[/h1]
Ummm...作为一款解密类游戏，简单到有点侮辱人类智商的嫌疑。
[list]
[*]举个栗子，游戏中你可以莫名其妙的找到一个带钉拔的锤子，然后不需要努力就发现了一个被4颗钉子钉在地上的密码版。
逻辑顺序根本就不符合正常人的思考逻辑嘛。难道是先有了工具然后才有的劳动需求？这简直就是赤裸裸的耍流氓嘛！
（为啥说莫名其妙？因为像带钉拔的锤子这种即可锤东西又可撬东西的模棱两可的工具，毫无预示就出现在你眼前，你却不知道为啥要点击它，难道因为点击它能够收将其进随身栏我就要点击它吗？究竟是为了锤钉子还是拔钉子？还是说两者兼有？?你完全是猜不到的嘛。）

[*]再举一个栗子，游戏中有小地图移步功能，亚当沃尔夫刚被枪击处于身体极度虚弱的状态下居然可以随身携带一个25公斤左右的灭火器跨地图瞎跑跑，这不是让人哭笑不得嘛。编剧可以，给你点个赞。


[*]总而言之，游戏流程固定而死板，内容逻辑关系混乱而没有惊喜，解密内容简单且重复度偏高，编剧散漫让人无力吐槽。
[/list]

[strike]个人建议是：打折了也别入（脑壳疼）[/strike]

感谢阅读此评测。

[h1] Information [/h1] 

Adam Wolfe ist ein psychologischer Thriller, welcher von Mad Head Games entwickelt wurde.

[h1] Gameplay [/h1] 

Verschwörungen, Dämonen und eine verschwundene Schwester! Schlüpfe mit diesem revolutionären Wimmelbild-Abenteuer in die Rolle von Adam Wolfe - ein Detektiv, der sich auf Übernatürliches spezialisiert hat! Angetrieben von dem geheimnisvollen Verschwinden deiner Schwester, wagst du dich durch die schattigen Straßen von San Francisco, wo Verbrechen und paranormale Ereignisse sich verflechten. Löse ein Geheimnis nach dem anderen, um eine größere Verschwörung zu enträtseln, die dich zu deiner Schwester führen wird. Somit beginnt dein Abenteuer.

[h1] Pro [/h1] 

+ fesselnde/düstere Story
+ wunderschöne Hintergründe und Grafik
+ schauriger Soundtrack
+ interaktive GPS-Karte mit Schnellreisefunktion 
+ Rästel und Wimmelbilder
+ Errungenschaften und Trading Cards

[h1] Kontra [/h1] 

- kurze Spielzeit von 4-5 Stunden

[h1] Fazit [/h1] 

Adam Wolfe bietet dir ein herausforderndes Gameplay, eine bewegende Storyline und ein dunkles Mysterium.  Klare Kaufempfehlung für Fans dieses Genres.

34188096.review:
I'll recommend Adam Wolfe to anyone that wants an adventure, Hidden object & puzzle game with a more supernatural detective feel to to it. The game's story structure reminds me of a mini-crime investigation series, with the three first episodes having their own sub-plots, which gets resolved within the episode itself, and the overall story-line being the side-story until the final episode where it all gets resolved. 

[u]Negatives:[/u]
None of the characters are really all that interesting to be honest. But then again that is more a crime investigation game, so the focus is more on the mystery than the characters themselves.
I feel like the main character's motivation is kinda cliché? Investigating supernatural cases because of a family member's disapperance. Don't get me wrong, it is a good motivation and drives the season storyline forward. But it feels very much like a standard back story. (Kinda like having a Super Hero with a dead family member.) 

Some scenes are a bit too action packed for the relaxing gameplay. I always think it feels weird to fight in point-and-click gameplay. It just feels weird having to find matching symbols while fighting a monster, or having to slowly take aim in order to shoot your opponent. It fits in the story, but is weird with the gameplay.

[u]Positives:[/u]
The setting is modern-supernatural. It is established early on that you are a supernatural detective, and the way people interact with Adam, both his friend in the police department and others, it is clear that he is not a joke. Which is really nice, considering how many times people try to set supernatural events in our modern world, and just say "It is all happening in secret and people don't believe it". Sure, the secret societies is still secret, after all it is a mystery game, but you don't really encounter the overused lines with "magic/demons/ghosts aren't real!"

The developers do a good job at setting the mood for a crime investigating story with their background, brooding serious protagonist, and their sound.

The episodic format works well with the story being told. Again, it actually makes it feel like you are playing through a small crime investigation season, where you focus more on other stories until the final episode.

Most solutions to the game's puzzles are logical, which does making it a bit "easier" than some adventure games out there. But mostly it just helps to make it a nice and relaxing experience.

33950096.review:
По цене и обилию положительных отзывов подумалось, что это неплохой микс жанра "приключение", "головоломка" и "найди предмет".
К сожалению, на то, что это нечто большее, чем типичный "найди предмет" указывает только цена.
Рисовка стандартная для такого жанра игр: обилие цветовых пятен и разных предметов, натыканных в сцену для количества и не всегда имеющих с этой сценой нечто общее. Часть объектов и большинство персонажей даже не являются рисунками, а лишь обработанными фильтрами фото (часто использован фильтр "акварель" из стандартного набора фотошопа). Доработанные фото/3D сцены в этом жанре не новость, но тут они так слабо обработаны, что это заметно.
При таком подходе об атмосферности речи быть не может. Сюжет так же не радует оригинальностью и предсказуем. Игра изобилует нелепыми предметами и конструкциями, которые могут существовать только в жанре "найди предмет", а не в реальной обстановке (как и в большинстве игр этого жанра). 
Головоломок в игре почти нет (за всю первую главу была только одна), чаще всего придется просто выполнять элементарные задания (по перестановке или подстановке частей) в 2-3 клика.
Как "найди предмет" игра вполне неплоха, как "приключение"/"головоломка" не выдерживает критики.
Если вы играли в игры от Jetdogs Studios, типа Dracula's Legacy, Cursed, Frankenstein: Master of Death, то вы знаете, чего ожидать от данной игры.
Если вы надеетесь на стильную детективную игру, заинтригованные трейлером и высокими оценками, вы разочаруетесь. Здесь все тот же незамысловатый набор для любителей поиска предметов, который можно найти в играх в 3-5 раз дешевле этой.

P.S.: по впечатлениям от первой главы, т.к. остальные проходить не захотелось.

33947782.review:
Okay, so...not exactly being a veteran of Hidden Object Games, I thought I'd make things breezier on myself by playing this one on Easy with the Tutorial switched on. What at first seemed, then, like a potentially complex and varied bunch of mechanics soon became quite intuitive and user-friendly, though I suspect I would have suffered more "stumped" moments if I hadn't made things so painless for myself. Suffice it to say, more experienced HOG-gers may not need to stoop to such lows, but for newcomers such as myself, it's recommended. Just like the game I'm about to review, 'cause I gotta say, for a newbie I was pretty impressed...

   Not that this game has a reputation for being a typical, run-of-the-mill HOG by any stretch. Apparently it's quite the eclectic mixture of HOG and other point-and-click adventure tropes, and I have to say, it definitely "worked". At least for yours truly. Perhaps the main thing I'm saying here is that I didn't quite know what to expect - and held off buying until reviews convinced me otherwise - but I'm quite pleasantly surprised, on the whole.

   So what DO you get with this game? Scares? Not really. Atmosphere? Sure. Story? Yup, definitely. A cracking good mystery? Hell yes! In fact, this is possibly where Adam Wolfe excels most, both in its storytelling and its chosen form of interactivity, as there's a legitimately "detective"-esque vibe to it all which actually makes you feel like you're slowly unraveling a mystery, with the occasional moment of life-or-death action to add some real-time tension to it all. That said, there's no denying there's an element of smoke-and-mirrors - the game gives you so much to click on that the ILLUSION of interactivity sometimes exceeds the reality thereof - but when said design tactics create such a genuine sense of involvement with the story, it's pretty hard to complain.

   I honestly enjoyed it, and would recommend it to almost anyone with a penchant for the "darker" side of gaming, irrespective of other genre preferences and prejudices ("I usually only play third person shooters with minor platforming elements", etc). I certainly won't hesitate to buy the other episodes when I spot them on sale, as five or six bucks an installment is admittedly a tad steep given the length of gameplay on offer (I completed this one in well under two hours). Oh, and as a final selling point for those of you worried about abrupt and unsatisfying endings, rest assured that this first storyline - while it certainly opens the path to others - is a fairly self-contained story in its own right, should you choose to end your adventures there.

   So really...what have you got to lose? Especially on sale. It certainly left me keen to try out more HOG-style games in the future.

Verdict: 8.5/10.

(PS For anyone who was wondering, like myself, if the game name and main promo image were suggestive of a cheap Alan Wake rip-off, the similarities honestly end there. Personal myth busted.)

33798161.review:
If you're looking for a contemporary take on the "old"Point N Click / Adventure SCUMM type games that doesn't lean too heavily into the tedium of the less-appealing (imo) Hidden Object tag often associated with the gameplay of recent releases in that genre, then this game provides for some well-done visuals, ambiance/sound effects and most prominently voice-acting. I think the frequent voiceover / narration from the protagonist adds to the immersion and brisk-feeling pace of the game,while the game's overall setting (investigating paranormal activity) suits this genre well for a modern take. 

I haven't run into too many of the afore-mentioned "Hidden Object" sections in this game, which can feel very plodding and "click around until you're just done with them" in other titles for myself, but I also don't have the patience of playing what seems like an intrusive, glorified "Eye Spy" type mini game very often in the middle of many Point and Click style games, and find their frequent pairing with the genre obnoxious. They are thankfully sparingly used in this title. 

If you've yet to try out a recent title in the Point and Click genre, this game presents itself well with its characters, voice-acting, and graphics, Adam Wolfe despite its wack ass title is a well-made game in that genre. If you're into detective type settings in games, with a darker storyline and "magical" or paranormal/macabre type elements (i.e.  Silence of the Lambs, Wolf Among Us, etc...) you may want to give this first episode a go as well. That being said, I'm still early into the game and do find myself not being super-invested toward it on the whole. I was able to snag the season on sale, and may get around to it at some point, but find my progression in this title to definitely be in brief increments.

33760138.review:
[h1]Short version: 70%[/h1]
Adam Wolfe has issues deciding if it wants to be an interactive thriller or a standard hidden object game, so it is neither really. Both of its halves are good enough to recommend the whole package, but only with some reservations.

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
Adam Wolfe is a strange experiment that mixes the popular interactive episodic adventure format with traditional hidden object gameplay.

Despite its engine limitations, the story manages to offer everything we could want from a supernatural thriller about a paranormal investigator who is looking for his missing sister—including a serious tone, good dialogues and characterisation, and even many action scenes.
Like in most other episodic investigation-centric adventures, it is at its strongest during the initial individual cases, but loses steam as the arcing plot takes precedence. The only strong point is that the narrative uses its main motif, time, quite effectively to the very end.

Adam Wolfe gets shaky with its balance as the gameplay enters its little world. The first two episodes are all about setting up the basics and introducing us to its premise through many cut-scenes, but in return, the minimal gameplay elements fit smoothly in the narrative. In contrast, the last two episodes play like any usual HOG, completely sacrificing the storytelling for some nice hidden object scenes and minigames.
Maybe if the game had stuck to one style, it would have been better in the end. As it is now, Adam Wolfe is more like an interesting experiment that provides some decent fun for HOG players, but not something that will revolutionise the genre.

33544769.review:
I acquired this game from Tremor Games, so kinda sorta free.

This is a really good HOG, though the earlier episodes are definitely better than the later ones. Also, secret orders are a bit overused; 3 in 4 episodes. The story is about a paranormal investigator named Adam Wolfe (Yes, there are several puns based on his name), searching for his missing sister. Apart from the last episode, and maybe the second last, each of the others is a separate mystery that tangentially relates to the main one. Episode 1 deals with a fire demon, episode 2 is about a mysterious puzzle box, 3 deals with a painter's murdered wife, and 4 is about your sister.

The gameplay is your standard HOG fair, though the earlier HOS are unique in that you are only given one object at a time, with an explanation as to why you are finding it. Unfortunately, later HOS are more standard fare. Puzzles are standard, except for 1 card game, though they are all pretty easy.

As far as cons go, the character models can look a little weird sometimes, and Adam Wolfe kinda acts like an idiot sometimes (seriously, just he just trusts a shady client to not give him a soul stealing puzzle box in ep. 2, or ep. 3's client to not be the murderer). The season also ends with a few loose threads, setting up some plotlines for a possible season 2 (yes, please).

Overall, pretty good, definitely recommended, especially if you like single player story driven games and point and click games.

32705705.review:
[b][u]Overall Rating: 8.5/10[/u][/b]

Really interesting HOPA, fairly unique in the more Narrative driven game, with a decently good story. A bit odd for some people perhpas, dark and occult themed. But I really enjoyed the blood, violence, occulty theme and bizzare goings on, and hideous demon type characters.

Definitely not for kids. No nudity, but the subject matter is not light-hearted, and the story does have a somewhat somber ending. People sensitive to paranormal, occult, dark themes that invlove violence,  blood, death (lots of death), simulated gunfire and demonic energies... yeah. May not be for you.

[b][u]Pros:[/u][/b] 
[list][*]Really good voice acting, good emotions, good flow, easy to understand, and the voices really fit the characters well. [*]Nice visuals. The art was pleasing, if you like dark and dreary, with a flair. Very well done stylng, and good flow through all episodes with the art. [*]Decently good story. Flows well from episode to episode. A little short in a few places, as if some small detail got cut, but nothing glaring, and enough depth to keep you interested and going on. [*]Nice fast travel map once enabled, and in areas where you are allowed to use it. This did take some leaving one area to trasition through a door to another before it was allowed, but it was not immersion breaking or game slowing, and actually made sense. [*]Decently ominous music for the story and settings, a bit reptitious at times, but not jarring or too much in front of the actual game. [*]Nicely done Hidden Object scenes, not too easy, not too complicated.  [*] 4 Difficulty modes to choose from, so the most casual or time limted players can enjoy it as much as the most hardcore HOPA players who want time limits and misclick penaties. Nice variety to choose from.[/list]

[b][u]Cons:[/u][/b] Not too many here, just a few, none too major-
[list][*]Puzzles were a bit too easy for my tastes, but they were different from the average HOPA, so it balanced out nicely. [*]The Magic Watch was a bit boring and uninteresting, but it needed some gimmick, eh? [*]Not much replayability. Only a few areas where you can make different choices, and it does not seem like those will have much effect on the outcome of the game. 7.7 hours for a single playthrough on the 3rd Difficulty setting, not sure I will play it again anytime soon. But maybe in the future, just because I liked the subject and the hunky male protagonist, and the voice actor who played him so much, lol![/list]

Full price may be a bit much for this game, but on sale I say "Get it!" if you like dark themes and enjoy really narrative driven HOPA's or HOG's. If you don't like a ton of talking, voice acting, and lots of cutscenes, and only want puzzles and HOS's, this may not be the game for you. But then again, it may. I generally don't enjoy Narrative driven HOPA's, and this one was very enjoyable for me, and would have lacked a ton if it wasn't narrative driven.

I can't recommend it and the Season Pass at full price, not enough value for the time there. But on deep discount, well worth it. I got the game and Season Pass on sale during the Summer Sale for around $4 USD, and consider it money well spent.

Your mileage may vary. Drive carefully.

31779215.review:
[b]Adam Wolfe[/b] (IHOG) 

Options include Full-screen/Windowed, Aspect Correction, Custom Cursor, choice of Language, and separate sliders for Music, Ambient, Effects, and Voices.  There are four difficulties to choose from:  Easy, Medium, Hard and Custom.  The tutorial is optional, and you are given this choice at the beginning of each episode.

I've never played a game quite like this one.  It's kind of like the casual version of an action-thriller-adventure game with some hidden objects.  The HOS are mostly finding things that help progress the story, and each episode adds something a little different to the gameplay.  There was one scene where we were trying to bruteforce something, and I just had to laugh... finding alternate ways to get things done is something I do on a daily basis! :laugh: 

There are a few things that stay the same throughout for continuity's sake, such as:

- Intense Focus - Pinpoint things that are out of place, and use them to recreate the scene.  I know that sounds like "spot-the-differences", but it's quite different - There's only one actual spot-the-differences scene in the whole game. ;)

- Adam's Gun - It's a dangerous job you know~

- Mysterious Item which I won't spoiler here - Allows us a whole new layer of investigation and recreation

- Voice Acting - We have the same voice actors throughout, and with only one exception, they are all VERY well done.

- Art Style - This is a gritty tale, and though there is a very noir feeling throughout, the devs were still able to give us beauty along the way without negatively affecting the immersion.

During narrative sections, if clicking doesn't make the story progress, then you need to find the item on the screen that is written in ALL CAPS.

I mentioned Action, but it's pseudo-action, which consists of clicking to fill up a meter, and/or clicking the right place.  As far as I know you can't actually die, but I didn't test that theory out.

There are 27 achievements, though you'll only have to work for a couple of them - the rest you will get simply by playing and completing the game.

The story, while far-fetched as far as the law enforcement side of things goes, was very interesting, and the game really started to shine at Episode 3 (for me, anyway!)  It really had a [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/242780/Cognition_An_Erica_Reed_Thriller/]Cognition[/url] feeling to it, though this is a more casual-games kind of difficulty.  The ending gives us some closure, but also leaves things open enough that there can be further installments with Mr. Wolfe down the line.

The first episode lasted me two hours, and the full season took me 6.7 hours, according to Steam.

I have to say that I really enjoyed the game, and was pleasantly surprised by how different it is.  This is a narrative-driven experience with a low emphasis on finding hidden objects, so if you're looking for something HOS-laden, Adam Wolfe may not be your cup of tea.  If a story of mystery and danger appeals to you, this one's right up your alley~!

Die Rätsel und Minispiele sind also eingewebt in die Lösung unserer Fälle. Denn wir spielen einen Ermittler für übernatürliche Fälle. Bedeutet das wir trotzdem wieder eine ziemlich wirre Story haben, aber sie wird ganz anständig erzählt, mit Zwischensequenzen, Gesprächen mit NPCs, etc. Insgesamt betrachtet definitiv eines der besten Spiele dieses Subgenres soweit ich es bisher beurteilen kann. Leider bleibt mir ein Wermutstropfen, einige der Minispiele erscheinen mir zu künstlich erzwungen und stören dann mehr den Spielfluss und die Atmosphäre als zu nützen. Da wäre weniger mehr gewesen.

31030771.review:
[h1]颇具亮点、制作精良的隐藏物品冒险解谜类游戏，讲述旧金山一位神秘事件调查员破获离奇事件并寻找失踪妹妹的故事。[/h1]

[h1]基本信息[/h1]
[b]标题[/b]: Adam Wolfe
[b]开发商[/b]: Mad Head Games
[b]发行商[/b]: Mad Head Games
[b]类型[/b]: 隐藏物品（HOG, hidden Object Game）冒险解谜

[h1]总体印象[/h1]
Adam Wolfe是一位旧金山的超自然现象的侦查员，一直思念他那离奇失踪的妹妹，他有一个感觉，每破获一件奇特犯罪案件，就离他妹妹失踪的真相更近一步。
本游戏在大鱼平台上被拆成了两个游戏，Steam上为完全版，一直在等全章节打折没想到等来了游戏进IG包，遂赶紧入手。游戏剧情分为4章，基本6小时可通关，每章一个案件，三四章进入找妹妹的主线，剧情表现力非常出色，但是却虎头蛇尾，结局竟然是打911警察来收场，最后我都不知道主角是生是死。
本作的画面和音乐都属于上游水平，游戏配音水准也不错，不会有其他HOG游戏那种经常让人出戏的棒读。
游戏有着各种让习惯了流水线HOG的玩家感到眼前一亮的设定。主角的手表，可以回溯时间来重现案发现场，在剧情和解谜中都扮演了重要的角色，是个出彩的设计。游戏的战斗是连续按键和谜题的结合，初见时尚还觉得有趣，但数量有点过多后期让人厌倦，如果能减少战斗增加谜题的话能更好。寻物环节的尴尬植入一直是HOG游戏为人诟病的通病，紧迫氛围中在垃圾堆里找寻需要的道具，直接拿上所需道具不就行了，为什么还要点上其他一堆无关的东西呢，Adam Wolfe对此环节的处理就比较合理，比如第一章中的寻物环节是在办公室的纸箱里翻老东西，每点一样物品都会借主角的嘴来交代这件物品所代表的回忆，不仅让找物环节契合剧情，也无缝交代了主角的人生经历和对妹妹的羁绊，是本游戏的亮点，但是寻物谜题太少，有点意犹未尽。游戏谜题很简单，基本上都很直观。
总体来说是一款非常值得一玩的HOG佳作，希望Mad Head Games能亲自把更多作品搬上Steam，之前Mad Head Games游戏在Steam上都是由大鱼发行的，没云存档和成就，非常不上心。

[h1]优点[/h1]
[list]
    [*]出色的剧情表现力。
    [*]优秀的寻物和谜题设计。
    [*]精美的画面、音乐，合格的配音。
    [*]基本不影响理解的官中。
    [*]云存档、成就、卡片一个不缺，成就很容易获得，基本通关就拿的差不多了。
[/list]
[h1]缺点[/h1]
[list]
    [*]寻物太少，迷题偏简单，战斗较多后期让人厌倦。
    [*]剧情收尾草率。
[/list]

[b]总体评价 7/10[/b]

一个十分优秀的【剧情】解密优秀，剧情是着重点，很少能看到一个讲出一个好故事的点击剧情游戏了，被流行线公司 Artifex Mundi荼毒的心在此有所复苏，流畅的故事性，简约而有趣的剧情，如同马克思佩恩那样的电影剧情流程，不面瘫的人物面部表情，反派塑造的还可以，没有像AT公司作品那样说是魔神邪教不如说是我朝乡村传教大队，不过依然有着不少的槽点：反派就是喜欢打昏主角不杀，墓地、海边这么好的地方就是不动手，非要玩各种捆绑束缚PLAY，最后一次竟然虽然犀利的杀人了，但是不补刀是硬伤啊，啧。
补充：烂尾！烂尾！烂尾！我不知道这是不是和奇异人生制作组那样因为缺钱而导致最后结局做不美满但好歹比蓝调与子弹制作组要强些~

  游戏性方面:没有用硬币转螺丝、钻石割开玻璃（好吧我错了，最后一幕还给我来一个钻石+玩具吸盘割玻璃）、树脂修船我先舒了口气，取而代之的是用灭完火的灭火器砸玻璃，领带勾铲子砸窗前先用布包着等比较科学的桥段。融入大量现代化元素，非常优秀的手机摄像头，能够拍出一张检查出人员的指纹照片来，没有各种枯燥无味的找钥匙找硫酸找铁丝剧情，一言不合咣咣就是干，我喜欢。点击剧情使用描述寻物+常规寻物，虽然前者在快捷性方面不如直接把一裤衩物品的文字直接放上来的快但听听故事倒也不会感觉枯燥，谜题方面还是比较老套，乍看之下很有意思，其实只是新瓶装旧酒而已（打牌那个除外），但也可能也是我玩此类游戏太多的缘故吧，希望在部分谜题中可以进行简化工作比如重复动作一次只能完成一个还需要一个个去点比如那小刀割手红布去灰，不少谜题有这官方吐槽XX你怎么这么多事XX你怎么这么多疑XX你搞毛冲这个我要吐槽一下，你自己都说完了我们玩家说个啥啊！

本土化方面我很欣慰的看到研钵没有翻译成迫击炮，排除部分地方有乱码，基本词句意通达，这就够了。
BGM不错，不过也就仅仅是不错的程度罢了。

最后的烂尾太特么伤心了，通关全成就了火速删除，总体评价：一碗鲜美的蘑菇汤喝到最后发现里面混了一小粒毒蘑菇。当然你如果出续作补上这个坑的话我会修过这个评价的。

30783749.review:
I highly recommend this casual point-and-click adventure, but I want to make sure your expectations are not overly hyped.

First, despite this being divided into four episodes, they are each quite short. The total amount of content is comparable to other games in this genre. Second, gameplay is [I]very[/I] casual. There are no significant challenges, even in “expert” mode. Puzzles are very easy (if they can even be called “puzzles”) and the handful hidden-object scenes are trivial. This is basically a “click here, click there” game, which isn't a bad thing--it's very soothing and smooth--but you should know what you're getting into.

With that in mind, this game represents new production standard for casual point-and-click adventures. The story is riddled with plot holes and laughable characterizations, but is very well narrated. High points are graphic-novel-like scene direction, satisfying “action” sequences, and voice acting that is head-and-shoulders above other games you have played in the genre. This is what “AAA” polish looks like for a casual point-and-click adventure. I would love to see more of this, hopefully in games that offer real puzzle solving.

Note that though the game doesn't natively support Linux, it runs perfectly over WINE.

30023139.review:
[h1]TL;DR[/h1]
A great game with a intriguing story line, really nice graphics and a different take on the hidden object genre of games. However, I would recommend waiting for the game to go on sale as it's rather expensive for the hours you will get out of it.

[h1]Introduction[/h1]
Adam Wolfe is a hidden object game that attempts to take the traditional hidden object genre and create a entire 4 episodic adventure game out of it. It's developed and published by Mad Head Games, a developer known for their hidden object games that have a interesting story line to it to make it more interesting. However, in my personal opinion as much as I enjoyed the game I think the price is quite heavy for the amount of hours and enjoyment I got out of the game itself.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Now I would like to start that before I played this game, I was always kinda on the fence with the entire hidden object genre. The games never really interested me all that much, and just the thought of spending hours upon hours looking for objects on a screen seemed rather dull to me. But after playing Adam Wolfe, I can say that these types of hidden object games are way more interactive and interesting to generally play. With a story line that was interesting from start to finish (with a few dull moments mixed in every now and then) really made me want to keep playing the game.

If I had to compare this game with a couple of genres it would have to be point & click, puzzle and hidden object for obvious reasons. The game plays out like a point & click/puzzle game, but with the hidden object style mixed in you are always collecting new items that will somehow help you overcome obstacles along the game and although sometimes the game doesn't use common sense it still makes relevant sense to do what you had to do. I was generally satisfied and felt achieved once I figured out how to get somewhere using what object to use at certain places to progress through the game. Although that might be because I'm not the smartest person when it comes to video game logic.

Throughout the game you will come across several puzzles that you have to solve in order to progress. However, the game does feature a rather nice mechanic that allows the player to skip the puzzle after a certain amount of time. I quite liked this option, as puzzles can completely ruin the pacing of a game especially an episodic game. As well as the ability to skip puzzles, the game also has a hint button that recharges so if you're stuck then you can use it to figure out what to do. I quite liked the recharged hint instead of a set amount of hints that you are given as again this can ruin the pacing of the game for the player. The hints delay recharge would depend on the difficulty that you chose, and that's the only thing that the difficulty has to do with the game entirely.

The story throughout the game was nice, and really the only reason why I kept coming back to the game. I really wanted to know what was going on and the game kept drawing me in, with each episode I felt like I was closer and closer to finding what I was looking for. (Avoiding any kind of spoilers) Each episode was broken down into different investigations that all tied into one another as the game went on, which obviously left the final episode with all the clues and people you needed to find what you had lost. I really felt like the game pulled me in with it's story and it was really way more interesting than I first thought.

I have to say though, when I first started playing the game I was unsure about the graphics/artwork of the game altogether. I felt like something was off, this was some graphics in a game that I hadn't really seen that much of and was therefor sceptical about it. But, much like before, as I played through the game I got used to the graphics and started to appreciate them more, there were a couple of cut scenes in the game that were rather nice, however some of them didn't look up to standard compared to some of the better looking cut scenes.

Despite all of the positive aspects of the game and the few negatives that I have mentioned I do feel like there is one factor holding this game back from people who like the look of this game. The cost. I personally spent about 8-ish hours playing through all the episodes at my own pace and I would say that the game wouldn't take any longer than maybe 10 hours to complete maybe a bit more. Even though I got this game to review I still feel like I wouldn't be satisfied with the price I would've paid for the game. Spending £15 on a game which only lasts from 6 - 10+ hours to me personally feels way too expensive. I feel like the game could've been released as one big game instead of 4 different episodes, and the reason why I think its this expensive is because it's a episodic game. I would wait for a sale if you're planning on buying this game.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
- A nice hidden object/puzzle game that includes a intriguing story line
- Skippable puzzles, avoids ruining the pacing of the game by being stuck at a puzzle you aren't able to figure out
- Interesting story that kept making me want to play more
- Rechargeable hint (recharge delay depends on difficulty chosen)
- Great graphics/artwork after I got used to it

[h1]Cons[/h1]
- Some cut scenes didn't seem to be 'up to standard' compared to some of the better cut scenes
- Too expensive, could've been released as one game instead of 4 episodes and made cheaper (wait for a sale if you're planning to buy this game)

[h1]Result / Final Thoughts[/h1]
I'm really unsure whether to recommend this game or not, because even though the game is great, it has a interesting story, great graphics and so on, I feel like the price of the game is way too expensive from the amount of hours I played for and the enjoyment I got out of the entire game. However, I understand that the price of the game can't really out way all the positives that this game has to offer, so I am recommending this game, although [b]I WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND WAITING FOR A SALE BEFORE PURCHASING THIS GAME.[/b]

29869290.review: Adam Wolfe is a HOG game of upper quality: the graphics are beautiful, the voices are rather good (didn’t like the villain voice but the rest was ok), the search screens are colorful and beautiful, the music is nice, and there are some fun action phases similar to QTEs. The story is cliché but it is very well told, you’re never left wondering what the hell you must do next. In fact that may be the biggest con of that game: it is so linear! i.e.  you’re constantly guided, literally pushed to the next sequence.  Yes this is very common for HOGs but in this one it is so obvious that often it’s more a visual novel than a game. However the game is so well done that it makes up for that. 29603110.review:
Adam Wolfe - знаковая игра для студии Mad Head Games по двум причинам. Во-первых, это первый полностью самостоятельный проект студии. Думаю многим из вас известно, что всегда издателем игр Mad Head Games выступала американская компания Big Fish Games. Во-вторых, Adam Wolfe это настоящая революция в жанре! Игра сохранила в себе большую часть классических элементов Hidden Object, при этом привнеся что-то новенькое - сумасшедшую динамику, нехарактерную для жанра, эпизодичность и кинематографичность. Если бы еще была возможность выбора в некоторых моментах, игре цены не было!

Мне кажется, решение издать Adam Wolfe самостоятельно выглядит совершенно оправданно, по крайне мере для игрока. Благодаря этому мы видим в игре Steam-достижения, карточки и поддержку всех вариантов перевода. Если взглянуть на многочисленные релизы Big Fish Games в Steam, то можно убедиться, что все вышеперечисленное отсутствует вовсе. Надеюсь Mad Head Games продолжите подобную тенденцию, и дальше будет радовать игроков своими великолепными релизами.

Adam Wolfe удивляет с первых минут - эпизодичность, упомянутая мной ранее, очень удачно вписывается в концепцию и сюжетные перипетии игры. Кто скажет, что видел подобное раньше в жанре, - ошибается. Да, можно было увидеть различные части, связанные между собой сюжетно, но каков был перерыв между выходом этих самых частей? Месяцы, а порой даже и годы. Здесь же разница между эпизодами смехотворна, всего лишь несколько недель. Сюжет не успеет забыться, да и интерес к игре не пропадает.

Сюжет в Adam Wolfe - одна из самых сильных сторон. Нам предлагают взять на себя роль детектива, живущего в Сан-Франциско и специализирующегося на сверхъестественных делах. Ко всему прочему, у главного героя, брутального мужчины средних лет, при очень странных обстоятельствах пропадает сестра. Словно одержимый Адам пытается найти любые зацепки, которые помогут ему приблизиться к разгадке этой тайны, при этом у него есть уверенность что без мистики здесь не обошлось. Четыре дела - четыре эпизода. И каждое из этих дел приближает нашего героя к его цели. 

В первом эпизоде герой расследует серию таинственных поджогов, пронесшихся по городу, ко всему прочему полиция скрывает тот факт, что во время каждого из происшествий пропадает человек. Во втором эпизоде игрока ждет еще одно необычное дельце, незнакомец просит Адама открыть необычный куб, в котором по легенде находится эликсир, исцеляющий от любой болезни. На момент написания обзора, оставшиеся эпизоды еще появились в продаже, но уже известна дата их выхода. Третий выходит 21 Октября, а четвертый - 4 Ноября.

Если вы давний поклонник жанра Hidden Object, то будете приятно удивлены сумасшедшей динамике, которая предлагает игра! Погони, перестрелки, постоянная смена декораций, смерти действующих персонажей и неожиданные сюжетные повороты. В игре множество головоломок, логично вписывающихся в происходящее и благодаря невысокой сложности, совершенно не замедляющие темпа, взятого разработчиками.

Единственное, что меня немного расстроило, так это рисовка. Местами можно наблюдать откровенно размытые изображения, из-за чего совершенно непонятно, что нам хотели показать в том или ином моменте. Вдобавок можно обратить внимание на некоторые сюжетные нестыковки. 

Итог:
Студия Mad Head Games в очередной раз подтвердила статус новаторской студии, которая не стоит на месте, а старается привнести что-то новое. Adam Wolfe порадует игроков отличным сюжетом с мистической подоплекой, динамичным геймплеем и рядом интересных идей. Настоятельно рекомендую ознакомиться с проектом всем любителям приключенческих игрушек.

29575530.review:
[b]“The timeless in you is aware of life's timelessness. And knows that yesterday is but today's memory and tomorrow is today's dream.” ― Kahlil Gibran, [i]The Prophet[/i][/b]

Right at the beginning I must say that even though they are my favorite type of casual games, I am not easily impressed by hidden object games. You see, I've played many, many of them and they all end up following a basic formula, never surprising you. They are like comfort soup. It's not grand, but you are used to them and find it to be enjoyable, so you always find that sense of familiarity with each new one. But I've just finished all 4 episodes of this game without nearly taking any breaks and I am impressed! The overall quality of [i]Adam Wolfe[/i] is breathtaking to say the least. Now I already knew that Madhead Games was one of the big guns for the HOG genre anyhow, yet I've never had the pleasure of playing any of their other games before. Gosh, I must make a personal note to watch this developer more closely in the future.

Our titular character, Adam Wolfe is a detective of the paranormal, living in San Francisco City. We are not given the details of how he has come to be specialized in that particular area, but he has one ultimate goal besides keeping the city he lives in safe and in one piece: that is to find his sister, Allie. Adam's sister has gone missing some time ago without a trace, and since then, he's been trying to investigate the case, without any solid leads. He keeps having the same disturbing nightmare about her over and over again. Most his friends and the police think that she is already dead. Yet, he keeps looking, hoping that he may come across something relevant in each new case he takes.

Establishing the baseline for our character and the setting, this first season of the game - yup, this whole adventure consists of episodes, guys and girls and I bet we will hear more from Adam as the time passes - centers around a mysterious cult and its influence over various cases that Adam has been working on. Oddly enough, the deeper he gets into this whole mess, the closer he seems to get to finding his sister! Now what could be the connection here? Well, that is for us to find out. At the end of the 4th episode, we are presented with an elaborate storyline and a huge cliffhanger. Only "time" will tell.

The story pace heavily relies on narrative and the portrayal of all characters are vivid through this narrative. For the most of my experience, I felt that I've been playing a light-weight but excellently done adventure game rather than a HOG. Sure, the gameplay dynamic is a HOG in the end, but all cinematic cutscenes, dialogues and investigation processes invoke the feeling that you are actually looking at an interactive novel. You are directly involved with Adam's reaction rate while he fights, escapes, investigates etc. most of the time, with various mini games. Story build is fast-pacing yet elegant, keeping you within the flow of the adventure without you even noticing the passage of time. The best part is that plot twists DO actually surprise you! The paranormal detective concept itself might sound like a cliché, but the execution here makes [i]Adam Wolfe[/i] stand out from various other examples.

Artwork is top notch quality, animations are brilliant - especially for this genre - and the environment design is surprisingly satisfying. I ended up just watching the place rather than going on with the game more than once. Characters look and act alive, with a marvelous amount of attention to detail, whether it be a change in their voice, or a piece of attire you might find peculiar. Whole design has an air of Vertigo Comics, with proper shading, decent shadowing, successful color combinations etc. It all feels realistic in a manner. Voice acting is amazingly good too, maybe the best that I've encountered in a HOG so far.

So... we've come to the crucial part of this thing: the gameplay. [i]Adam Wolfe[/i] mostly consists of item collecting and combining with various puzzles, true. But it has certain unique qualities that I've never seen in this genre. There is a unique investigation process, which allows you to take a closer look to the crime scene and even travel back in time to the exact moment of the crime to deduce what might have happened. HOG scenes themselves are not various, but they serve something that I've never, ever seen in a HOG before: the storyline! Each HOG scene - alongside most of the puzzles - do serve to progress the storyline! For example, a friend of yours agrees to make a concoction for you at some point, and a HOG scene appears as he ask for ingredients from you to pass from the shelf while he is working. The narrative and HOG scenes pace together, eliminating the awkwardness of "how the hell this thing ended up being here anyhow?" Now this is a huge success and a revolution for this friggin genre. Puzzles themselves are not incredible, but they are appealingly polished versions of many classical ones. They don't force you 'till you get suicidal, neither annoy you with their simplicity.

For the bottom line, [i]Adam Wolfe[/i] is a really great light-weight adventure rather than a HOG and it most certainly delivers a successful storyline with interesting characters, a fast paced game flow and awesome display quality. I would like to say that the full-price might be an exaggeration, but it is not. Go for it if you enjoy the genre!

Please also check out Lady Storyteller's Curator page [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/ladystoryteller#curation]here[/url] - follow for regular updates on reviews for other games!

It's not a bad game in and of itself. I just regret spending so much money on it because in my opinion, it wasn't worth it.

29473177.review:
A story-driven casual adventure game with the feel of an urban fantasy novel. Story/gameplay integration is Mad Head's strong suit, and that definitely shines here with a streamlined narrative that generally avoids the typical weird HOG logic. (This regresses a bit in Episode 4, but [spoiler]considering it's basically a dream, that actually seemed kind of clever in retrospect.[/spoiler])

As is often the case, however, paring down the arbitrary puzzles, backtracking, and padded repetition of hidden object scenes results in a game that isn't very challenging, even if you disable hints and skips, and has a relatively short play time. (I finished all four episodes in about 5 hours, where I'd expect the average HOG to take 2.5-3 hours.)

The art design is generally good, and I especially love the character design for [spoiler]Death[/spoiler], but some of the animation looks really wonky, particularly the unsettling warping effect used for the lip flaps. (I'm not sure if it got worse as the game went on or I just noticed it more, but the mouth movements in Episode 4 seemed particularly off.)

There's some interesting worldbuilding beginning in Episode 2, but it's let down by the abrupt ending. It kind of feels like they're teasing a sequel, but moreso it feels like the climax fizzles out into nothing. Just a short epilogue cutscene could have helped tie things together. The lack of special features was also somewhat disappointing.

I really enjoyed [i]Adam Wolfe[/i] despite its flaws, and I'd definitely recommend it if you're interested in hidden object games that try something new instead of rehashing the usual formula, but you should probably wait for a sale.

Intriguing and exciting!

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Adam Wolfe is a point 'n click game with an incredible system of puzzles and exploration where you use the mouse most of the time. Despite the simplicity of gameplay, the game get you with the amount of items to explore and difficulty of the puzzles. Controls are simple and respond perfectly. I would say that it is a hybrid between hidden object and adventure games. At certain times you need to fight by pressing the right buttons and even shooting at enemies.

[h1]Plot[/h1]
You are Adam Wolfe, a supernatural detective. Splitted in 4 episodes, these are mini-stories that fit together and give structure to the main plot. Adam solves cases that have some sort of supernatural involvement, which seem to clue Adam's missing sister. The characters are interesting and the story catches you.

[h1]Graphic[/h1]
Amazing. The modeling of the characters is perfect, I'm not sure, but it seemed to me to be photo-realism. The cutscenes impress you until the last episode. Scenarios are 2D with multiple 3D objects. The colors are mostly vivid, making the game relaxing and comfortable.

[h1]Soundtrack[/h1]
Original and instrumental music, mostly with mystery atmosphere. Perfect in every moment of the game.

[h1]Rate: 10/10[/h1]
I've always enjoyed investigative games, but Adam Wolfe impressed me with unusual features in this type of game. History is another factor that made me like it so much, awesome structured and intriguing, you'll probably want to end the game in one go. One of the awesome games released in 2016, bad I didn't discovered it till 2017. Worth it!

29443120.review:
In Adam Wolfe, you'll be setting demons on each other, shooting criminals in the face, rewinding time and facing off with Death. It is about time someone made a hopa like this. It's cinematic, mature and very fast paced. You play as a detective who investigates the supernatural, who gets caught up in a battle between cultists and demons. It feels like the plot comes first, which is a nice change for this sort of game.

Adam Wolfe isn't a protagonist who gets an easy ride through the story. You won't be playing as the chosen one, you won't always win and there will be consequences to your actions. If you're tired of point and click games with locks on every door, drawer and filing cabinet you find, this is the game for you.

   Adam Wolfe é um jogo de: investigação, puzzle, point and click e uma exploração opcional. lançado no ano de 2016, no dia 7 de outubro.  Por que uma exploração opcional? A exploração só sera necessária, caso corra atras da platina do game.

Sê vale a pena? Coloque na balança e diga você mesmo, mas já adianto que é uma experiencia incrível.

29350667.review:
Published by: Mad Head Games 
Developed by: Mad Head Games 
Genre: Adventure, Hidden-Object, Puzzle, Mystery
Release Date: 7 October, 2016
Time to complete: 1.5 - 2 hours per chapter (depending on experience in genre)

[h1]Introduction[/h1]
Embark on a mysterious adventure as Adam Wolfe, a renowned supernatural investigator, as you find hidden objects to help you in your investigative pursuits.

[h1]Story[/h1]
Adam Wolfe is a highly immersive, story-driven episodic series, with a different case in each chapter; though there is an underlying backstory which progresses throughout the series. You play as Adam Wolfe, a former police officer turned paranormal investigator, preoccupied with the disappearance of his younger sister, Allie. As a new case is solved, more clues arise concerning the disappearance, and along with it, more questions. The story is easy to follow, despite the many interconnecting storylines and many unexpected twists.
[b]**Story outline below. If you want the whole storyline to remain a mystery, skip the rest of this section.**[/b]
The story begins with what is seemingly an arsonist running around the city causing havoc. Realising that this is more than just a simple case of a mad pyromaniac, the police force assign Adam Wolfe to the job, in hopes he can solve the mystery. As Adam follows the clues, he realises this is far more than he had bargained for. Small details display resemblances with the information he already has regarding his sister’s disappearance, and thus the search continues, taking him to dangerous and infernal places.
The second chapter involves a mysterious magical box, it’s peculiar contents taking Adam on a spine-chilling discovery of demonic possession, secret societies and ancient cults.
The third chapter follows the story of a troubled painter, as Adam finds more and more clues that connect the cases with his sister’s disappearance before finally, the fourth chapter sheds some light on how it’s all connected.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
From each chapter, you are able to choose whether you would like a tutorial, and to what degree you would like help with; full, special features only or no tutorial. I found this to be very helpful in the first chapter as someone not particularly well-versed in the genre, and liked the in-between option that is also available. There is also a hints system, which I will explain in more detail in the next section of my review.
The game boasts a very useful modern addition; the smartphone. Via the phone you are able to fast travel using the map function, use GPS when traveling in vehicles, check the objectives you have completed and are currently working towards, call and send images to contacts and a ‘?’ tab which contains case-specific information (such as things you have learned from clues or speaking to others). There are several handy and impressive features in the ‘’loadout’’ section: intense focus, a gun and a mysterious watch with special abilities. Intense focus is one of my favourite additions, as it allows you to find important clues and piece them together yourself. 
Parts of the story are played out in an interactive comic strip style, often showing combat, conversations and other segments key to the story. There are many different mini-games throughout the chapters packing a refreshing challenge without being repetitive or boring, the puzzles seemingly advancing in difficulty as the game progresses. 

[h1]Difficulty & Challenge[/h1]
Adam Wolfe has extensive options in terms of difficulty to cater to both experienced and new players. There are 4 difficulty options: easy, medium, hard and even a custom difficulty where it enables you to configure the difficulty options to suit your preferences and playstyle. These difficulty options enable (or disable) the use of hints, determine hint recharge rate, enable (or disable) indications of important places of interest and even have a penalty for rapidly clicking in hidden object puzzles (hard difficulty).
The hint system really adds to the flexibility of challenge; for example, the easy difficulty enables you to pretty much use as many hints as you wish (though there is still a short cooldown), whereas the hard option disables the use of them entirely.

[h1]Graphics & Art[/h1]
Mad Head Games were spot on with the artwork in Adam Wolfe. The imagery captures each scene perfectly, portraying a realistic representation of all the destinations and characters. With so many locations within the game (there are 53 across the 4 chapters), it’s impressive that the attention to detail is there throughout every scene.

[h1]Soundtrack & Audio[/h1]
First of all, and one of my immediate thoughts upon playing this game, is the voice acting is [u]very[/u] well done, specifically that of Adam Wolfe. One issue I have found with playing narrative-based games is that the voice acting can come across as rather dull and forced. Adam Wolfe is far from that, with the tremendously well-written script merging perfectly with the voice acting to create a truly immersive experience. The ambient soundtrack really builds on that immersion, helping to set the scene of mystery and trepidation so vividly.

[h1]Replay Value[/h1]
I don’t find that there is much replay value in narrative-based games, especially those of the mystery genre. Given Adam Wolfe is highly dependant on the constant build-up of clues, once you’ve finished the storyline I doubt a second playthrough would have the same immersion.

[h1]Achievements[/h1]
All the achievements can be obtained simply by playing through all the chapters ([i]if[/i] you do not use the hint function for any of the hidden object puzzles).

[h1]Overall Verdict[/h1]
Adam Wolfe is a captivating mystery adventure with a large amount of varying puzzles ensuring that the game never gets stale, repetitive or boring. The story is incredibly immersive and highly addictive (I pretty much binge-played through the whole thing as it had me wanting answers), and one that will stick with me for a while. The fact that it has difficulty options to cater to any kind of player makes it a perfect choice for anyone interested in the mystery genre.

[h1]Overall Score: 9/10[/h1]
