29292267.review:
[h1]Basic Information[/h1]
[b]Title:[/b]  Adam Wolfe
[b]Developer:[/b]  Mad Head Games
[b]Publisher:[/b]  Mad Head Games
[b]Genre:[/b]  Adventure

[h1]General Impression[/h1]
I have played over the years, more than a few HOGs (hidden object games) and they were usually “lifeless”, if you’ll indulge my metaphor. Just a rapid succession of locations filled to the brim with seemingly random objects that could not really be connected to a coherent storyline. By contrast, Adam Wolfe reminds me dearly of old school adventure games in which solving puzzles, wasn’t slowing the pace of the overall story. 

Every good tale needs at least one likeable protagonist and of course, a noteworthy antagonist/villain. I will do my best as to not spoil the game for you. Reviewers have to tread even more carefully when treating the subject of adventure games, since they usually follow a liniar plot (and relatively few repetitive actions) thus going too much into detail, could really diminish the experience for any new players. Fear not, as I shall stick to a general description. Adam Wolfe in his own words, is a detective of the supernatural. I did appreciate that he isn’t in any way hindered by private eye stereotypes or given any exaggerated traits, just for the sake of standing out. So you don’t have a heavy drinker/smoker or womanizer, in the fashion set by the Noir genre’s own detectives. Besides solving cases that the police can’t handle, he’s a man on a mission to find his sister which had mysteriously vanished many years ago. That is the main plotline, revealed to the player from the very beginning and it is the one element that links all four chapters within this game.

As I mentioned above, Adam Wolfe is split into 4 parts, with the first chapter being able to be bought separately for a more than decent price tag and once you are convinced of the game’s potential and quality, you can safely purchase the last 3 chapters in the form of a season pass. That is of course, if you have doubts about the game since you can also purchase the entire season (out of several more to come, I hope) for a better offer. This is ultimately your choice.

Speaking of choices, you have quite a diversified selection of puzzle to solve within Adam Wolfe. Few ever repeat a pattern and the attention of details is obvious. This isn’t a rushed game in any circumstance. Even the difficulty ladder won’t cause issues for those that only casually play this genre of adventure games. Most puzzles can be skipped, if you ever find yourself in doubt or you simply wish to progress the story with no obstacles in your way. Obviously, my advice would be to at least try and solve them, before hitting the Skip button. So far, I’ve met only intermediate puzzles and riddles which wouldn’t take very long to solve, even when pressured by time.

And time plays a crucial role in this title. Earlier in the first chapter, you find bizzare wristwatch that someone left in your office. It can be used to manipulate certain locations in order to witness events in which you didn’t participate. Quite a nice feature, along with the self-explanatory Focus ability, a detective kit (for searching and collecting fingerprints) and even your trusty revolver, that will literally be a lifesaver. Such game mechanics ensure that you don’t get bored, no matter what location you travel to (and there are quite a few). Even the titular hidden objects, may hold further secrets that require a closer examination and may even reveal new clues or be used in conjunction with another item from your inventory.

The graphical details are almost a mix of 2.5D since some of the assets make good use of shadows and motion in order to appear as more than 2D standard fare. But the locations you discover and sweep for clues, are nicely drawn and the same thing can be said of the rich cast of characters. The only flaw into an otherwise near-perfect adventure game, is the lack of certain sounds and especially voice acting. During dialogue the characters are fully voiced, but when inspecting objects and the like, we are just given a silent subtitle. I remember the good old adventure games I used to play and they always had audio feedback no matter on what you clicked along the scenery. This is still a minor nuisance and should not deter anyone from trying out Adam Wolfe. I will most certainly keep playing it until I shall solve all the underlying mysteries within it.

[h1]Strong Points[/h1]
+ Beautiful hand drawn graphics.
+ Intriguing storyline and likeable characters.
+ Excellent selection of puzzles (which can also be skipped).
+ Steam Achievements & Trading Cards

[h1]Weak Points[/h1]
- Full voice acting wouldn’t hurt it for all the in-game text.

[b]Rating 9/10[/b]

29175539.review:
[h1]Investigator of the Paranormal[/h1]

Adam Wolfe, supernatural PI and scruffy do-gooder, just cannot get a break. Trying to uncover the whereabouts of his missing sister, case after case of unholy paranormal activity manages to find their way into Wolfe’s way. Fire demons, immortals, banshees, and time manipulators are just some of the things he will come to face on the journey to save Allie.

[h1]Wolfe’s HOPA[/h1]

At its core, Adam Wolfe is a hidden object puzzle adventure. For those unfamiliar with the niche genre, understand that HOGs, especially modern ones, strongly adhere to the same formula regarding game design. If you’ve played one AM game, you’ve played them all. There are only so many ways HOG designers create their puzzles, and long-term HOPA veterans have no problems breezing through every game. To be fair, nearly all HOPAs cater to the casual community and many games include gameplay options to allow one to customize how casual or hardcore to make their gaming experience; either way, don’t expect a challenge. There is a hint button after all. Regarding the story, it will always be some grandiose adventure filled with supernatural beings. Otherwise, it will be some sort of themed setting/series of games (vampires, demons, haunted houses, mythology, etc.). Nothing tame, mundane, or ordinary.

You may be wondering, “Well what’s the point?” The thing is that HOGs are mostly hit or miss. If you like it, most likely you will end up loving it. Many HOG fans are die-hard fans. Always craving for more puzzles, even if they’re only reskinned or exactly the same, just like me. If you are a fan of HOGs and HOPAs in general, you will absolutely be very familiar with the style of play, artwork, puzzles, and HOGs present. What makes Adam Wolfe different from many AM games here on Steam is that Wolfe is much more cinematic than its competition. There’s more of everything in AW: cut scenes, fully-voiced dialogue, comic-book style transitions, etc. This leads to a much more memorable story and immersive gameplay. It’s also nice that there aren’t potato quality video transitions in between beautiful scenery landscapes. 

[h1]Complete Walkthrough Playlist[/h1]

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=StH-QYig_hI&list=PLeavCsRFiP57pDmUvjwcqbjZxQEmpKJWW&index=1

[h1]Verdict[/h1]

As a modern release, the artwork is crisp and beautiful, and the game has a large sense of polish. I’m still unsure about how I feel regarding the game’s ending since some issues are left hanging, but with a strong allusion to a sequel (along with its more cinematic aproach), it is fairly easy to recommend this game. If you’re just another HOG junkie making sure this game isn’t a total burn, it isn’t, and you should go ahead and indulge yourself. Just beware that unlike most HOGs, especially on Steam, Adam Wolfe’s full story is broken up into 4 distinct and separate episodes. Each episode revolves around one major paranormal force, slowly introducing clues to the hidden entity responsible for Allie’s disappearance throughout. Make sure you purchase the entire season with all 4 episodes, and not just the first episode.

Although I’m a bit sad that the hidden object genre can be a bit stale and repetitive with very few innovations in point & click puzzles, Adam Wolfe seems to take a step in a more interesting direction of story-telling, and I absolutely thank them for it. There isn’t anything mind-blowing here, but I definitely think that AW is one of the top HOGs on Steam.

29052504.review:
A point and click game unique to the genre which has a dark and sort of spooky feel to it.

The protagonist (Adam Wolfe) is a private detective dealing with the supernatural (they took inspiration from the TV show [i]Supernatural[/i] I feel). The game is split up in to 4 chapters, each take about 1 hour to complete. Each chapter is it's own sort of mini-story which will help piece together the main story. While Adam is solving cases in each of the four episodes, it contributes to the bigger picture of Adam searching for his missing sister who mysteriously disappeared. The story was very intriguing and kept me interested the whole way through. I really feel like the first two episodes are the strongest, with the 3rd and 4th chapter feeling a little bit rushed (in the story department).

The game has traditional point and click features like puzzle solving, Hidden Object scenes and using items to advance. What sets it apart from other point and clicks I've played, however, is that there are a lot of action scenes as well (using your gun and fist fighting). Many MANY people die, and the ending of the game isn't a happy one either. The other interesting aspect is that of going back in time to re-inact certain scenes in order to piece things together. You actually get to be a detective, and I think that's pretty cool.

The game is fully voiced and the cut scenes look really good too. There are also sections that imitate comic book style panels, and those also look very sharp. Most of the achievements are story based, and unlike other point and click games, it doesn't force you to play on Expert or not skip/use hints. There are very few Hidden Object puzzles in the game, so those are very easy to do without using hints. It has a multitude of different difficulty settings, which all appropriately scale up in difficulty. I also feel like the puzzles were fairly easy (you only need to do four in a row without skipping for an achievement, and can skip the rest if you want) and the game was very managable without ever feeling frustrating. 

Because you'll only probably get 4-5 hours of gameplay out of this, the retail price of 10.99 may seem steep for some. Would definitely recommend during a sale though, as this is a very fun and stimulating game.

28864426.review:
Adam Wolfe:
~~~~~~~~~~

Inexplicable fires are erupting all around San Francisco! Is it the work of an arsonist or is it something truly out of this world? The local police can’t take any chances in this matter and will leave no stones unturned. They need the help and expertise of a supernatural detective, and the only person to turn to is . . .  Adam Wolfe!

Adam Wolfe is a point and click adventure/hidden objects/puzzle game spread over four episodes. As the title leads us to believe, you will be playing Adam Wolfe, who is an expert in investigating supernatural cases. Interestingly, Adam’s sister vanished a couple of years ago under strange circumstances. Since then, he has been trying to puzzle together what happen to his beloved sister.  This case might have some answers on his sister’s disappearance; but then again,  it might not. I guess you’ll just have to find out. 

As point and click is the preliminary aspect of the game, you will also encounter several hidden objects stages. What I like about them is the fact that the clues are narrated to you via voice as well as in written form, which grabs your attention on another level in my opinion! 

Also, fairly early in the game, you will find a special watch which gives Adam Wolfe the ability to travel back to a specific time. With this great faculty, Adam will be able to see what happened to some people at that chosen time. In some situations, Adams will have to amalgamate clues to understand an intriguing situation and this intense focusing ability will be extremely valuable to him. He will take on some interesting fights, too. Some with hid bare hands and some with his mighty revolver. Is he a good fighter or a good shot? Ummm. . . you will find that out! As he is an ex-police officer, Adam’s kept good relations with Marv, a police officer who he will contact via is mobile phone from time to time.

Graphically, this game is great and I really like the cut-scenes. In terms of the controls, traditional point and click / hidden objects mechanism. To top it all off, the story is great and the game as a whole is very compelling!

Positives:
~~~~~~~

- 	Good graphics and cut-scenes
-	Great story
-	Good puzzles
-	Very easy to play 
-	Achievements and trading cards

Negatives:
~~~~~~~~ 

-	The voice acting could have been better

Adam Wolfe is a well construct point and click adventure game with good puzzles and fun hidden objects stages.

7/10

Key provided by developer/publisher for review purposes. Any opinions expressed are entirely my own!

28705349.review:
This is, by leagues, the most intricate and deep HOG I've ever encountered. Partially that's due to its remarkable running time - the game's 'season' is 

broken up into four hour-long 'episodes' - although simple running time has little to do with the game's successes. After all, Evil Pumpkin dragged on for 

hours and hours with almost no content to it at all. What so impresses about Adam Wolfe is the fact that each one of its chapters is a fully fleshed-out 

story with its own cast of characters, as well as a beginning, middle, and end.

Players take on the role of Wolfe, a supernatural detective determined to solve the mystery of his sister's disappearance - as well as help out the other 

three people who need his expertise in their own storylines. Each one of the stories is a fully satisfying experience, and had the developers been 

interested in doing so, they could have tacked a few extra puzzles and HOGS into each and sold this as four different games. Instead, they've released 

one of the most dramatically satisfying HOGs ever made.

Now, on to the hidden object criteria!

Criteria 1: To what degree do the puzzle screens look like a thrift store vomited on my monitor?

Not at all. Mad Head Games have gone above and beyond to create HOSs that look completely believable. Obviously aware that this is an issue in 

poorly-produced HOGs, they set all of the hidden object scenes in plausibly cluttered locations. Adam goes digging through an old box of personal 

effects, a bartender has the player searching through a packed shelf, there's even a child's treehouse absolutely stuffed with toys. All of the screens are 

beautifully drawn, with items hidden completely naturally. There's no cheating of any kind, yet the screens are never pushovers - great care was obviously 

taken to ensure that the items to be located match the art style of their surroundings. This is as good as hidden object scenes get from a presentation 

standpoint.

Criteria 2: Are the searches justified by the premise/story?

Again, this is a perfect example of developers going the extra mile and showing how much they respect their audience's suspension of belief. While the 

game doesn't have a ton of HOSs - there are just a few in each episode - the majority of them are fully integrated into the plot. There are some narrative 

screens, in which the player is asked to find a series of items as part of a story being told, justified lists, where they have to find puzzle pieces under a 

series of items, and plenty of mini-puzzles, that have them finding and using a series of items all within and intricately-designed screen. There are a 

couple of basic 12:1 screens as well, but by and large Adam Wolfe's HOSs are some of the best-integrated ones around.

Criteria 3: How well do the various puzzles and object searches meld together to form a coherent whole?

Incredibly well. Adam Wolfe offers a huge variety of environmental interaction, standard puzzles, and action sequences, all of which fit perfectly within the 

game world. The main character operates in a strata of society full of ancient secret orders, scheming demons, and otherworldly threats - of course he's 

going to have to open a few puzzle boxes here and there. Beyond the standard puzzles, however, the game has a few interesting mechanics of its own to 

offer. Most notable is the 'time rewind' mechanic, in which Adam arrives at the scene of a crime and has the ability to look backwards to the moment of 

tragedy - simply move a few items so that the the physical space has been reset, and the player is treated to a rotoscoped re-enactment of the action.

What truly impressed me, though, was how well the game managed to integrate action sequences into the gameplay. So many games stumble with 

fistfights and gunplay, but Adam Wolfe pulls it off with aplomb. There's frantic tapping, some symbol matching, and even a two-axis aiming sequence - and 

they all work just fine. This is a more intense, action-packed HOG than I'm used to, but it never asks too much from its player, managing to remain an 

accessible casual experience even when things get violent. And get violent they do - Adam shoots a surprisingly large number of people over the course of 

the game, yet another one of its standout points. The game is so well-built that I even enjoyed the card game I played against a supernatural foe at one 

point - and I tend to skip adversarial puzzles because of my well-established history of being terrible at them.

From beginning to end, Adam Wolfe is operating at the absolute peak of the art of HOG design. Compelling stories, great gameplay, challenging yet fair 

puzzles - this is as good as casual adventures get, and is an absolute must-play for any fan of the genre. If I was forced to find a single complaint about 

Adam Wolfe, it's that at the end of the game the story isn't completely over. All of the mysteries have been solved, but there's a fairly substantial dangling 

plot threat that might frustrate some. I tend to look at it as a good sign - it suggests that the developers intend to make more Adam Wolfe games - which, 

if this one is anything to go by, would be a fantastic result.

28655266.review:
Right from the beginning, I knew that Adam Wolfe was going to be a great game. Everything about it looked so polished: the music was terrific, the art was amazing and the production was simply exquisite. From start to finish, Adam Wolfe continuously proves that it's a HOG masterpiece that should be in every HOG fan's library, despite the slightly demanding price considering the 10 hours length over the course of all four episodes.

The game is, as well stated after the initial splash screen, "an intensive narrative experience". I would add "interactive" to that, since user interaction is one of the aspects that the game is very good at. The story is narrated from the protagonist's perspective and his actions are very often followed by cutscenes that act like a feedback/response to his actions, increasing the player's identification with the character and offering an immersive experience. Playing the game initially feels like watching a movie, but it soon transforms into the movie having the player as the central character.
This cinematic effect is achieved not only through video cutscenes, but also through action scenes that are presented as stylish comic book panels intertwined with interactive mini-games of shooting/fighting the enemies or driving around the town.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=791546542

I would presume that Adam Wolfe offers fewer mini-puzzles to solve than other HOGs. This is why it plays more like a story rich point-and-click adventure rather than a HOG, although it isn't lacking in Hidden Object scenes at all. On the contrary, these come in various types. There's the classic list of objects that you need find with its variant of having an outline of the object instead of the name; there's also the classic HOPA mini-games in which you have to find the objects and use them to unlock other areas of the scene. In addition to that, the developers thought up two new styles of hidden object scenes. For the first, neither the object name nor its outline is available, but instead the player is presented a nice descriptive text of it. The other type is my favorite so far, here the objects the player is searching for play a meaningful role in the story context of the HOG scene. For example, sequentially finding objects in order to deal with a bomb, trying them one by one and receiving a small piece of feedback after each of them about why this object didn't work and what the player needs to find next. Hidden object scenes integrated in the story flow in this manner substantially add to the player's immersion.

Another strong point of the game is the story itself. It's interesting, dynamic, thrilling, entertaining, with a few spooky elements - overall: a unique creation. Adam Wolfe is a detective of the supernatural - in each of the 4 episodes, he is tasked to solve a different paranormal case that gets him closer and closer to finding his sister, who mysteriously disappeared two years earlier. The story is not as predictable as one would expect from this kind of game and the ending is quite surprising.

Adam is equipped with a few interesting gadgets: his mobile phone also acts like a notebook, in which a quest list and pictures of access codes needed to solve some of the puzzles are saved.  Secondly, he has a magic watch that allows him to go back in time and investigate a crime scene, helping him to deduct what previously happened in that location. This is often combined with the usage of his focusing superpower - an ability that helps him to detect objects altered during the crime. He also has a gun and his fists that he can use during action segments.
 
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=791749013

The art team did a tremendous job with the visuals in this game: the locations are gorgeous and realistic, the lighting is faultless, the scenery is full of vibrant colors, an attractive and charismatic character. Every piece is a high-quality visual, even the animations are top-notch. Even more so, the audio is also a vital part of this game. The moody soundtrack goes along well with the mysterious atmosphere of the game and the voice-overs, especially Adam's, are very convincing. Even the intro screen and the menu is very stylish and the options panel provides a vast range of customization in relation to the difficulty settings and the in-game help system.

I highly recommend this game. It's an amazing creation, made with a lot of love and dedication.

28618583.review:
[i]Adam Wolfe[/i] is a hybrid between Hidden Object and Adventure genres. You play as a paranormal investigator that has to solve 4 strange cases.

[h1]Gameplay:[/h1]
In this game you control the eponymous Adam Wolfe, a private detective that solves other people's problems, whilst trying to look for his missing sister. The core gameplay is solving puzzles and looking for useful items that are hidden within the game world. Most puzzles are very simple, and can be solved within a minute, yet there are a few ones that can take longer to figure out. I was very surprised by the amount of interaction within the game - you are in control of almost everything. For example: using the fire extinguisher doesn't just consist of "combining" it with flames, you also need to manually spray it to extinguish the ongoing flames one by one. It's a very welcome change from all the "stiff" HOGs that I've played before.

You have a lot of useful tools that help you with solving cases: a strange watch that lets you look back in time, the "Intense Focus" ability that shows you things that haven't been there before, your phone that you use for taking notes, keeping track of objectives, and fast-travelling from one location to another, and last but not least, your trusty revolver that lets you, well... kill stuff!

The whole game is divided into 4 episodes with each episode being a different case. They may seem like separate stories at first, but they are all connected to your sister's disappearance. Each chapter of the game is chock-full of mystery and unforgettable moments, at times it made me feel like I was playing some kind of interactive movie rather than an adventure game!

[h1]Graphics:[/h1]
I have to say, I really love the artwork! Every location is masterfully crafted and full of small details, which makes them really nice to look at even for longer periods of time. Some scenes are creepy and eerie, while others look magical and out-of-this-world. I can't overlook characters and items, because they also look beautiful. It feels like you can learn a lot about characters by looking at their outfit, expression, even by the way they stand! That's a big plus for me because it makes you able to know the characters a little bit more if you are being observant.

[h1]Sound[/h1]
The ambient music is really good: it brings that vibe of suspense and mystery, and makes some of the locations even creepier that they were before. I can say that you're missing a lot of the atmosphere if you mute the music or play without sound. Moving on to voice acting, most characters have great voices that fit their persona, especially the protagonist. Some minor characters have slightly worse voices, but it's not much of a problem since most of them speak maybe 4 or 5 sentences throughout the whole game.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
An amazing game with simple but engaging gameplay, interesting story, and beautiful visuals. I have never before played such an addicting adventure game! I'm not a big fan of the genre, yet this game somehow kept me entertained to the end. [b]I recommend this game to every gamer that likes to play something more casual from time to time, no matter if you like HOGs or not![/b]

28480137.review:
I recently received this game for free from MadHeadGames. It is an episodic point and click adventure game with hidden object and puzzle minigames where the protagonist Adam Wolfe, a former police officer who became a detective of the supernatural had been searching for his missing sister Allie Wolfe. The 4 episodes begin with Adam Wolfe pursuing an arsonist, taking on a case from a mysterious client who needs his help with a strange puzzle box, investigating the ghost of a painter's wife to eventually find his sister. With some help from his friend Marv from the San Francisco police, the mysterious client Dez and Allie, Adam Wolfe investigates a series of supernatural occurences, numerous attempts on his life and the murders of various people connected to his investigations, goes into an induced state of near death to play and win at a card game with Death and eventually confront a person with the supernatural ability to use and manipulate time.

Each episode will take approximately 1-3 hours to finish. All puzzle and action minigames are easy to complete and forgiving for casual players. The game also has a fast travel option in the form of a GPS where locations that have all tasks completed or no longer accessible will be marked. Overall, recommended for fans who enjoy casual adventure games with puzzle/hidden object minigames and achievements that are easy to obtain.

28133871.review:
Mad Head Games did an outstanding job with this this game.  To me, this should definitely be game of the year.  As I was playing the game, I could see the time, love and their all that they put into this game.  I had been playing HOGS for around 9 years, and never came across one well done as this.  This was more like playing a movie not a game.  I was hoping out of the time I was playing all these years  that one team would come out with a game that would blow me away and Mad Head delivered.  The voice acting was superb.  The lips and facial expressions and body movements matched perfectly like your watching t.v..  In my opinion this is the game of the year.  I don't think I will ever see a game this well done by another team.   The one aspect of the game I loved was that you owned a revolver.  And you would have shooting matches with your enemies like cops and robbers.  That was fun.  Also note, there is a strategy guide that comes with the four episode version that was very very well done.  

Story:  You're on a mission to save your sister.  Adam doesn't know the ins or outs of what happened to his sister, but in each episode as he helps other people it brings him one step closer to finding his sister.  This is one very intriguing story.  Like a novel you couldn't put down.  You have to find out what's going to happen next.

Graphics:  Absolutely stunning.  A lot of the scenes could look real.  

Music:  I loved it.  They made it fit with what was happening in the scene at that time.  

Mini Games:  Very nice variety.  These games were made specifically for this game.

Map:  Very nicely done.  You have indicators on the map that sparkle telling you that is where you need to go to next.  It's also a jump map.  You also have a GPS you use when you are going to a new place.

Hint System:  Works very well on the outside of HOGS.  I don't see how you can get stuck in the game.  

HOGS:  I won't go into detail of the different ones, but it was a really fun variety of them.  In some you would play mini games which I truly love.

To me I highly recommend this game.  I'm not sure if Steam has a demo, but if you would like, Big Fish Games does have a demo.  Maybe give it a try if you like.  :-)  Kudos to the team again for an awesome job. :-)

28099610.review:
Na poli HOG her se objevil další hráč. Dokáže ale vzdorovat vysoce kvalitním počinům od bohů tohoto žánru, Artifex Mundi?

[h1]Co to vlastně je? [/h1]
Hra Adam Wolfe mě zaujala už z obrázků i traileru. Trochu mě odradilo epizodické vydávání, ale již jsou všechny čtyři epizody venku. I přesto, že reklamní materiál působí výborným dojmem, převládal u mě strach z toho, že hra nebude tak kvalitní.

Základní premisou každé dobré HOG hry jsou celkem nečekaně právě ony minihry s hledáním předmětů. A zde přišel první velký šok. V celé hře se dočkáte pouze pár obrazovek a to ještě tak zjednodušených, že o nějaké náročnosti nemůže být ani řeč. Bohužel to samé platí i o logických minihrách, kterých tu je vícero, ale na déle než pár sekund jsem se zasekl jen u jedné a to je prostě bída. I díky tomu jsem dohrál celou hru za nějakých šest hodin.

Jedním dechem ale musím dodat, že i přes onu nevelkou obtížnost jsou tyto logické hádanky a minihry opravdu chytlavé a inovací v žánru. Když jsem u nedávno recenzovaného Enigmatis 3 s nadšením popisoval, jak je úvodní sekvence parádní, akční a intuitivní, zde by se to dalo říct o celé hře. Dojde tady i na nějaké ty souboje či honičky, které jsou logicky zpracovány a jsou i funkční. Nemáte pocit, že by sem něco z toho nesedělo a hra tak krásně odsýpá. Navíc jako bonus je každá HOG scéna jiná, jednou tak musíte hledat dle slov,podruhé dle náhledu, potřetí pak zase jinak a díky tomu to není jen typické hledání předmětů.

[h1]Jmenuji se Wolfe, Adam Wolfe[/h1]
Ve hře se nachází hlavní dějová linka, která probíhá všemi čtyřmi epizodami. Je o ztrátě sestry hlavního hrdiny, postupně odhalujete, co se s ní stalo a působí to zajímavě. Bohužel ke konci jaksi ztrácí na atraktivnosti. Asi je to u mě dáno tím, že ona sestra hlavního hrdiny mi nebyla moc sympatická, navíc konec je tak pitomý, že jsem ho ani moc nepochopil. Skoro to vypadá, jako by tu měla být ještě pátá epizoda nebo aspoň epilog, aby se to celé rozumně ukončilo.

A pak tu máte v každé epizodě jinou dějovou linii, kdy řešíte různé případy. O co tedy jde třeba v první epizodě? Adam Wolfe je detektivem, který řeší nadpřirozené případy. Zrovna je na stopě žháři, z kterého se vyklube ohnivý démon. Hlavní hrdina tedy musí zjistit, jak tohoto netvora zastavit dřív, než kvůli němu lehne popelem celé jeho milované město.

Děj je hodně zajímavý, nabízí několik postav, se kterými budete mluvit a ke konci se dočkáte i pár zvratů. Vyprávění je filmovějšího rázu, celá hra je taková rychlejší než tomu bývá obyčejně v tomto žánru. Pokud tedy chcete pohlcující příběh, neváhejte a pořiďte si tuto hru.

[h1]Je to krásná podívaná[/h1]
Kvalita grafiky, stylizace, hudby a dabingu je opravdu špičková a občas jsem s pootevřenými ústy zíral na dění na obrazovce. Vše působí naprosto profesionálně a zamiloval jsem si i komiksové cutscény, které mi připomněly ty z Maxe Paynea.

Navíc celé vyznění hry je takové temnější, dospělejší a pomalu až noirové. A pro žánr noir mám prostě slabost.

[h1]Revoluce nebo evoluce? [/h1]
U hry Adam Wolfe je nejspornějším faktorem to, zda se jedná o HOG hru nebo ne. Za sebe můžu říct, že mi tento posun k akčnějšímu a filmovějšímu pojetí sednul. Abyste si to dokázali představit, je to, jako byste porovnali klasické adventury a "adventury" od Telltale. Vše je tu přizpůsobeno tempu hry, tudíž nečekejte záseky na několik minut nebo hledání desítek předmětů. Jak jsem se zmínil již na začátku recenze, je to opravdu škoda, že hra není těžší. Můžete si sami nastavit, kolik vám toho hra sdělí a jak má být těžká, jenže i na nejtěžší obtížnost je prostě jednoduchá. Pokud jste v tomto žánru aspoň trochu zkušení, nebudete mít jediný problém.

Bohužel tohle je největším záporem na tomto díle. Nenabízí žádnou výzvu. Projdete jí jako nůž máslem a i když si ji užijete, budete mít po dohrání pachuť na jazyku s tím, že to přece jen mohlo být o něco náročnější na vaše mozkové závity. Jelikož tu není moc místa na logiku, je vcelku jasné, že ani takový ten dobrý pocit z vyřešení těžší hádanky se nemůže dostavit.

Jakkoliv negativně vyzněl předchozí odstavec, hra Adam Wolfe je skutečně parádní. Posouvá žánr HOG her zase o něco dále, otázkou však zůstává, zda je to dobře či ne. Ale na to musí najít odpověď každý sám.

[h1]Plusy[/h1]
+ pohlcující hratelnost
+ úžasná atmosféra
+ novinky v žánru
+ zajímavý příběh a případy
+ parádní minihry
+ bezkonkurenční technické zpracování

[h1]Mínusy[/h1]
- jen pár HOG scén
- je to až příliš lehké
- délka hry kolem 6 hodin
- špatný konec

[h1]Konečný verdikt[/h1]
[b]Mé hodnocení: 8/10[/b]

Můžu říct, že tu před sebou máme opět nesmírně kvalitní počin, který rozčeřil vody HOG žánru a přinesl do něj několik novinek. Díky tomu na vás čeká nezapomenutelná jízda, kterou si užijete od začátku až do konce. A i když kvalita ke konci mírně zakolísá, i tak to je hra pro každého milovníka tohoto žánru.

26605522.review:
Hello!  This is an overall review of the four episodes of Adam Wolfe.  Without going into too much detail I will say that if you are a fan of the Harry Dresden book series by Jim Butcher and the television show Supernatural, you will probably like Adam Wolfe.  
     In each of the episodes you play as the character Adam Wolfe, a man on a mission to find his sister.  In every episode there is a new case to solve that comes with a supernatural twist, leaving tantalizing clues about what happened to your sister.  But fear not, with your trusty sidearm and no small amount of sarchastic wit--that's a superpower right? you can handle most things.  
     This is a game series that both beginner and seasoned gamers can enjoy.  The graphics are crisp, detailed, and well thought out; they add to the story rather than distract.  The puzzles/mini games are appropriate for the story, and the occasional pause to sort through the miscellaneous are brief and not overdone. Players with find themselves being drawn in to the enhanced world that Adam inhabits and perhaps not wanting it to end.  I highly reccomend this game.

I seriously hope Mad Head has more Adam Wolfe episodes in store for us in the future!

26521886.review:
When I was younger we used to have mini TV series in four parts. I loved this format. You had time to think about what has been happening, discuss it with friends, rush home for the next part. 
I was pleasantly surprised by the four episodes of Adam Wolfe. A solid detective adventure set in San Francisco, a case is solved in every episode and there is the arch over all four, the search for Allie, Adam’s sister.
Again this four part format gave me time to mull things over - and looking forward to the next episode.

Mad Head Games is no new territory to me. I’ve played most of their games and loved them. They always bring new and very creative elements in their HOPA’s.
In Adam Wolfe as well. Not only we play from two perspectives: we see Adam Wolfe in cutscenes, in graphic novel style story boards, then we change perspective and play as him. 
Sometimes there is a lot of action: we use a gun, have to hide, use our legs and feet, swing on the Golden Gate Bridge, drive, jump, get shot … phew!

Gameplay was great, music very catching, graphics fantastic. 
Voice Over was simply brilliant. In some HOPA’s you have the impression that relatives and friends read the texts just to have this bit covered, here it was absolutely professional and gripping.
Even after years of playing HOPA’s I still like Hidden Object Scenes, if they are as innovative as in this game. The puzzles were a good mix of new ones and not so new ones, but nicely presented.

Hopefully there will be more games in four parts by Mad Head!

26441785.review:
AUSSERGEWÖHNLICH… 

… gut …anders …spektakulär …unterhaltsam und …kurzweilig!!!! Ein sehr innovatives neues Projekt aus der Mad Head Games Schmiede! Ich kann meine Begeisterung kaum beschreiben – aber ich weiß auch, dass es nicht jedem Wimmelbild-Spieler gefallen wird – denn es wird auch sehr, sehr viel geredet – überwiegend aus der Sicht von Adam Wolfe (aber er hat eine äußerst angenehme Stimme!) – mir persönlich hat das SEHR gut gefallen, denn es verleiht dem Spiel eine gewisse Tiefe. Ich würde das gesamte Spiel als ein sehr interaktives Film-/ Comic-Adventure bezeichnen! Die Grafik der Schauplätze und der Zwischensequenzen in und um San Francisco ist für das Casual-Games Genre überdurchschnittlich gut gelungen! Rück- und teilweise auch Einblicke sind im Comic-Stil gestaltet und die verschiedenen Figuren sind grandios animiert – allen voran natürlich: Adam Wolfe, ein äußerst cooler Detektiv der alles gibt, nichts zu verlieren hat, der Übernatürliches untersucht und das Böse ohne Furcht bekämpft! 

Der Grundgedanke von allen 4 Episoden ist der Wunsch von Adam Wolfe, seine verschwundene Schwester finden und zu retten. Aber vor allem in den ersten beiden Episoden scheint es primär erst mal um den Kampf gegen diverse Dämonen zu gehen in denen wir noch keinen offensichtlichen Zusammenhang mit dem Verschwinden der Schwester ausmachen können. Ab Episode 3 schiebt sich die Suche nach unserer Schwester in den Vordergrund. 

Die wichtigsten Funktionen unseres Smartphone sind neben dem Telefonieren mit unserem Kollegen Marv, eine Aufgabenliste, eine Kamera und eine Karte, mit der wir zum nächsten Einsatzort navigiert werden. Hin und wieder kommen auch unsere Fäuste oder unser Revolver zum Einsatz! Eine seltsame Uhr, die wir schon in der ersten Episode erhalten, ermöglicht es uns, die Zeit auf eine bestimmte Uhrzeit zurückzustellen und etwas bereits Geschehenes schemenhaft mitzuerleben. Anschließend können wir sehen, dass 4 Dinge verlegt wurden – diese müssen wir entweder in der Szene selbst oder in unserem Inventar suchen und wieder richtig einsetzen um schließlich diese 4 Sachen in die richtige Zeitreihenfolge zu bringen – dies ergibt dann einen wichtigen Hinweis.

Die WIMMELBILDER passen immer gut zur jeweiligen Umgebung: Es gibt neben interaktiven Wortsuchlisten (auch schon mal mit hervorgehobenen Wörtern in einer Story), Umriss-Suchen – auch in Kombination mit Gefundenem wieder passend einsetzen. (Lustig ein Übersetzungs-Fehler: In einem WB wurde „Stirb“ gesucht, aber es handelte sich um einen Würfel = „Die“ im englischen)

Die MINISPIELE sind einfach bis mittelschwer zu lösen: Steine werden in die vorgegebene Aussparung gebracht, wobei die Steine erst bei einem Hindernis zum Stehen kommen. Kacheln werden gedreht, bis ein durchgehender Weg entsteht. Gleiche Runen werden gesucht, Bildkacheln zusammengepuzzelt und Blöcke verschoben. Scheiben mit verschiedenen Farben drauf müssen so gedreht werden, bis die Juwelen dazwischen in einer Farbe leuchten. Figuren werden über Schienen in die richtige Aussparung geschoben. Gleiche Symbole werden verbunden, ohne dass sich Linien kreuzen und Einiges mehr.


Was für eine großartige Geschichte! Alles SEHR, sehr interaktiv – oft dachte ich „warum geht es denn jetzt nicht weiter?“ – aber das liegt daran, dass man von den bisherigen Wimmelbild-Spielen zu verwöhnt ist, weil es dort fast immer automatisch weiter ging und HIER muss man  vieles ausprobieren und dann merken, dass das Abenteuer dann doch – durch unsere Mithilfe weitergeht… Wundervoll!!

26425845.review:
Terrific game. I came to the game later than most and played episodes 1-3 in succession and only had a week before playing the final chapter so my experience may be slightly different than others that did play it from episode to episode. The pacing of the story was fantastic, the voice acting was perfect and both of these elements kept me sucked in throughout. The visuals are beautiful and the music is equally so that it creates such a great mood for a detective story. The variety of puzzles and hidden object games is definately this games' strength - there is so many types I cannot list them here but again this keeps the game fresh from start to finish. 
The negatives probably there are two: Firstly the game is fairly easy, even on the hard mode...but this works well in the grand scheme as it keeps the story moving and I didn't feel bored due to that variety of puzzles. Second negative, and this is why I waited until the last chapter was out because it happens so often unfortunately, is it ends abruptly. There is just enough closure to feel satisfied but it does end with 'End of Chapter Four' and then credits and back to main menu. Two extra scenes would have been nice to polish it off. 
There is definately room for a sequel and I do hope they make one as I was blown away by the quality of this title after playing many hidden object games and this one does get the elements right. It's strength is the variety in the game and pacing of the story. The characters are interesting and I applaud them for getting this right in a 'casual' game where they are often 2 dimensional. 
Buy it now and enjoy the ride

26425384.review:
Just finished all episodes;
Adam Wolfe is the next level of Puzzle Hidden Object Games. It engages the player as much as possible to make the game stand out. I personally never expected to pull out a gun in a hidden object game and engage in shootouts or even drive. It keeps the action moving along, because you're learning new ways of interacting with the world. And there's always a lot to do, but none of it is complex enough to leave you frustrated or angry. It's just enough to keep things fresh and fun.
 
Everything is put together so well. The UI is so neat. The art is truly gorgeous. The cutscenes look like a comic book and they're a lot fun to look at. The audio shines in this game. Adam’s narration of the scenes leads to deeper immersion in the game. I even caught myself feeling sympathetic for him. I can't get over the voice acting, it's so gripping you'll find your emotions all over the place. Additionally, the ambient music enhanced the mood of the game and it was really catchy.

I enjoy a good mystery, supernatural/ detective games and this game was a treat. Whether you're a fan too or just enjoy HOGs, I urge you to try it.

26398099.review:
genre : point and click adventure game with HOG elements

score : 9/10

 You play as an investigator of the occult and supernatural, trying to solve the mystery of the disappearance of your sister in the city of San Francisco. Mystery involves paranormal happenings and the unnatural but in a realistic and believable way.

+ The presentation is the best i have seen in a casual adventure game, dynamic with sublime artwork.
+ Sound and voice-overs are excellent.
+ Story is interesting, dark and although it includes things of the supernatural the presentation is in a realistic way. I'm sure the developers have played gabriel knight before.
+ Gameplay is really fresh, it's almost entirely point and click gameplay as in classic adventure games with the HOG scenes being implemented as part of the story, which is fine by me - some action scenes where you have to use your revolver - scenes where you have to use your detective sense - other times you use a watch which helps reconstrust the past. All gameplay elements are explained well and they suit the progression of the story.

- Short in duration, but this is the 1st episode of 4 in total. The full season and for the asking price probably will be worth it as far as game length is concerned.
- Pretty easy, maybe this first episode acts as an introduction to the season, sometimes it feels like a tutorial.

 Bought this game during the halloween sale and i was pretty amazed by the production values. It seems Artifex Mundi have found a big opponent in the casual adventure games genre, or vice versa since i think this product quality wise is a big step forward for the genre. Will definitely buy the season pack and i am keeping my eye on these developers for other games in the future.

26083979.review:
[quote= Стивен Кинг. «Нужные вещи»]—  Мужчины и женщины, которые не могут расстаться с прошлым, — сказала тетя Эвви. — Вот кто такие призраки. А не они, — махнула она рукой в сторону гроба, что стоял рядом со свежей могилой. — Мертвые мертвы. Мы их хороним, и они остаются в земле.[/quote]

[b]Adam Wolfe[/b] - знаковая игра для студии [b]Mad Head Games[/b] по двум причинам. Во-первых, это первый полностью самостоятельный проект студии. Думаю многим из вас известно, что всегда издателем игр [b]Mad Head Games[/b] выступала американская компания [b]Big Fish Games[/b]. Во-вторых, [b]Adam Wolfe[/b] это настоящая революция в жанре! Игра сохранила в себе большую часть классических элементов [b]Hidden Object[/b], при этом привнеся что-то новенькое - сумасшедшую динамику, нехарактерную для жанра, эпизодичность и кинематографичность. Если бы еще была возможность выбора в некоторых моментах, игре  цены не было!

Мне кажется, решение издать [b]Adam Wolfe[/b] самостоятельно выглядит совершенно оправданно, по крайне мере для игрока. Благодаря этому мы видим в игре Steam-достижения, карточки и поддержку всех вариантов перевода. Если взглянуть на многочисленные релизы [b]Big Fish Games[/b] в Steam, то можно убедиться, что все вышеперечисленное отсутствует вовсе. Надеюсь [b]Mad Head Games[/b] продолжите подобную тенденцию, и дальше будет радовать игроков своими великолепными релизами.

[b]Adam Wolfe[/b] удивляет с первых минут - эпизодичность, упомянутая мной ранее, очень удачно вписывается в концепцию и сюжетные перипетии игры. Кто скажет, что видел подобное раньше в жанре, - ошибается. Да, можно было увидеть различные части, связанные между собой сюжетно, но каков был перерыв между выходом этих самых частей? Месяцы, а порой даже и годы. Здесь же разница между эпизодами смехотворна, всего лишь несколько недель. Сюжет не успеет забыться, да и интерес к игре не пропадает.

Сюжет в [b]Adam Wolfe[/b] - одна из самых сильных сторон. Нам предлагают взять на себя роль детектива, живущего в Сан-Франциско и специализирующегося на сверхъестественных делах. Ко всему прочему, у главного героя, брутального мужчины средних лет, при очень странных обстоятельствах пропадает сестра. Словно одержимый Адам пытается найти любые зацепки, которые помогут ему приблизиться к разгадке этой тайны, при этом у него есть уверенность что без мистики здесь не обошлось. Четыре дела - четыре эпизода. И каждое из этих дел приближает нашего героя к его цели. 

В первом эпизоде герой расследует серию таинственных поджогов, пронесшихся по городу, ко всему прочему полиция скрывает тот факт, что во время каждого из происшествий пропадает человек. Во втором эпизоде игрока ждет еще одно необычное дельце, незнакомец просит Адама открыть необычный куб, в котором по легенде находится эликсир, исцеляющий от любой болезни. На момент написания обзора, оставшиеся эпизоды еще не появились в продаже, но уже известна дата их выхода. Третий выходит 21 Октября, а четвертый - 4 Ноября.

Если вы давний поклонник жанра [b]Hidden Object[/b], то будете приятно удивлены сумасшедшей динамике, которая предлагает игра! Погони, перестрелки, постоянная смена декораций, смерти действующих персонажей и неожиданные сюжетные повороты. В игре множество головоломок, логично вписывающихся в происходящее и благодаря невысокой сложности, совершенно не замедляющие темпа, взятого разработчиками.

Единственное, что меня немного расстроило, так это рисовка. Местами можно наблюдать откровенно размытые изображения, из-за чего совершенно непонятно, что нам хотели показать в том или ином моменте. Вдобавок можно обратить внимание на некоторые сюжетные нестыковки. 

[u]Итог:[/u]
[i]Студия [b]Mad Head Games[/b] в очередной раз подтвердила статус новаторской студии, которая не стоит на месте, а старается привнести что-то новое. [b]Adam Wolfe[/b] порадует игроков отличным сюжетом с мистической подоплекой, динамичным геймплеем и рядом интересных идей. Настоятельно рекомендую ознакомиться с проектом всем любителям приключенческих игрушек. Моя оценка 9 баллов из 10![/i]

[b]P.S.[/b] Обзор написан одним из авторов [b]Special Games Club[/b]. С другими обзорами нашей группы вы можете ознакомиться [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/SpecialGamesClub#curation][u]здесь[/u][/url].

26008919.review:
[quote][url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/shprd95_reccomend#curation]підпишись[/url] на мою кураторську сторінку, буду вельми вдячним.[/quote][h1]В той час коли на ігровому просторі сьогодення ігрові жанри то раптово народжуються то попадають в забуття, непомітно для інших, час від часу фанатів радують виходом ігри жанру HOPA. Hidden Objects Puzzle Adventure – пригодницькі головоломки з пошуком прихованих предметів. Одною з таких ігор є новоспечена Adam Wolfe.[/h1]

Адам Вульф - детектив, який розслідує паранормальні явища в Сан-Франциско. Декілька років тому в нього загадковим чином зникла сестра, яку так і не вдалось знайти, але він не втрачаючи надії намагається все ж таки віднайти її. Дії гри починаються з розслідування серії підпалів приватної власності. І все б виглядало звичайною справою, якби не сліди в квартирі Адама, які вказують на те, що до цього причетна якимось чином його зникла сестра.
Сама гра розділена на 4 епізоди, які виходитимуть з певною періодичністю. Перший епізод мені вдалось пройти за півтори години. Емоції він викликав в більшості позитивні. Тому спочатку опишу ті речі, які мені не сподобались. Це доволі стереотипні персонажі за винятком головного героя, якого зробили досить цікаво. Хоча на детактива він зовсім не схожий, проте наділений особливою харизмою.
 Попри типову ігрову механіку жанру розробники постарались зробити проект максимально кінематографічним. Цікаві діалоги. Непередбачувані сюжетні повороти і побудова сюжету робить головоломку настільки цікавою, що бажання пропустики ролик зовсім не виникало. Весь епізод я пройшов на одному диханні. Головоломки тут досить прості, але цікаві, тому пропускати їх також бажання не виникало. Найбільшим плюсом гри є  її подача. В уяві легко формується картинка ніби-то з фільму. Грамотна, хоч і трохи банальна зав’язка, хід подій і кульмінація з несподіваним поворотом подій. Гра хоч і намагалась водити за носа, все ж таки я зміг здогадатись про то що злодієм насправді є інша людина. 
Як для гри такого жанру, сюжету тут більше ніж достатньо, так а вони ще й умудрились його гарно припіднести. Тому в порівнянні з іншими HOPA це однозначно новий рівень якості.
Тепер про саму ігрову механіку. Як було написано вище, гра відноситься до жанру головоломок з пошуком предметів, але те, як це організовано викликає позитивні враження. Навіть банальні сцени з пошуком зроблено максимально цікаво. Такі здібності як орлиний зір, за допомогою якого можна шукати підозрілі речі, або годинник, на якому можна перемотувати час до моменту злочину, револьвер, приносять не тільки геймплейне різноманіття а й ще більше створюють перед гравцем ілюзію фільму. Такі геймплейні елементи, як переходи між локаціями виконані оформлені у вигляді GPS на мобільному телефоні. Деякі діалоги з персонажами також реалізовані через дзвінки через мобільний телефон. Тому за увагу до дрібниць і вміло реалізовану інтерактивність гру можна сміливо похвалити. В плані звуку також все радує. Фонова музика погружає в атмосферу загадковості і розслідування. Вдало підібрані голоси для озвучки персонажів, хоча помічається певна апативність в голосі Адама. В цілому звуку також можна поставити плюс. З графікою тут також все добре. Акцентувати увагу на цьому я звичайно ж не буду.

[h1]Висновок:[/h1]
Безумовно, Mad Head Games підняли планку жанру, то дуже міцно її укріпили. Вдало вибравши стилістику та майже зруйнувавши цю, здавалось би, майже незламну грань між головоломкою та детактивним пригодницьким оповіданням розробники попали прямо в ціль. Браво.

25925043.review:
There is no denying this is a very well put together HO style game. Instead of the usual 'mostly static locations you move about and click on things with a few puzzles' what you get is much more like an interactive cinematic experience (with some HO and other puzzles thrown in).

The reason for the -ve rating is mostly value for money. I completed the 1st episode in under 80mins, without skipping any of the cutscenes. There were two, maybe three HOPs, and only one other puzzle which took more than a few seconds to solve.

So while it's very well crafted, I feel it's way too short. Especially as there are some pretty decent HO games out there with far more content and replay value, despite the (slightly) less glossy presentation. The whole series (4 planned episodes atm) may well be better than any of the other HO games out there at the moment. But will cost at least four times as much. And I don't feel the extra gloss is worth it. If anything, it actually detracts from the puzzle-solving aspects.

If what you want is a well presented interactive story (which is very standard 'supernatural dectective' fare) this is almost certainly for you. If you want puzzles and good value casual gameplay; then probably less so.

25914840.review:
Fantastic hidden object puzzle adventure (HOPA) game with a strong focus on the adventure.  If you liked any of Mad Head Games previous adventures you'll definitely like Adam Wolfe. 9/10
https://youtu.be/e2jQNROJohI
Pros:
+ Interesting story - film noir, detective, murder mystery (akin to Max Payne)
+ Fabulous audio - music, voiceovers, sound effects (nice work Jovian)
+ Graphics are gorgeous - animations, 2D / 3D art, comic book transitions
+ Controls are smooth and easy to learn with special abilities adding another layer
+ Puzzles are clean, rewarding and suit the theme of game

Cons:
- Episodes without release dates (at the time I reviewed the game)
- Lack of collectibles, extras (wallpapers, music, etc)

TL;DR I have recorded over 250 HOPA games and truly enjoyed every moment of this masterpiece.
